boardgame.description:
Summoner Wars puts you in the role of a powerful summoner in control of a unique army, dedicated to taking control of the war-torn planet of Itharia. Display your tactical prowess by summoning units to your gates, outmaneuvering your opponent, and cutting down the enemy summoner to claim victory. Be wary though! The enemy will take advantage of every opportunity they find to destroy you and your army.

Countless units, a wide variety of spells and abilities, and the option to build your own decks, all make for a game sure to entertain, play after play.

Summoner Wars (Second Edition) is a fully expandable, tactical dueling card game that features updated versions of beloved factions, along with exciting new factions ready to join the battle. The game — which features new art and a perfected rules system — can be played in-person with physical cards or online with a browser-based app.

boardgame.name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off 2
boardgame.description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select one of the Rayn cards and place it face up. Place the other two cards face-down on either side, these are Rayn's mitts. Place a coin at the top of Rayn's energy track and do the same for both mitts.

Remove the Cheesequake and Omen Biscotti cards. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding the rules listed below:

When you deal damage, target either of Rayn's mitts. If you reduce one of them to 0 energy, deal 1 damage to Rayn, and tilt the mitt to show that it is broken. You may only deal damage to Rayn directly if both mitts are broken.

On Rayn's turn, roll a die. If the result matches a number on one of her mitts, activate it. If the mitt is broken, fix it: untilt it and set the coin to 3 energy. If not broken, take the action shown on the mitt.

(One roll of the dice counts as a boss' "action". If they get an extra action, they roll an extra die. If they lose an action, they roll 1 less.)

VICTORY
If Rayn has 0 energy and you still have any, you win. If you are ever reduced to 0 energy, you lose.

boardgame.name: Barbarossa Brief, 1941
boardgame.description:
Brief as in both speed of play and File or Case or ... Dossier. :)

VERY small footprint Barbarossa game. Like Philip Sabin's classic Eastern Front, only **3** hexes from Warsaw to Moscow, although a different configuration of those.

4 2-month turns, basic hex and counter dice-resolved combat odds system. But lots of combat options including Pressed Attack, No Retreat! - isn't there a game by that name? :) - Siberian Reserve Gamble, etc. NO Zones of Control.

Playing time: est. 40 minutes.

Germans: 3 army groups, 1+1 infantry armies, 4 panzer groups, 2+1 panzerkorps. Romanian army group. Russians: 10 infantry fronts, 4 operational tank groups, the Siberians. +3 Russian tank factories (in Leningrad, Kharkov, and Stalingrad). So 31 pieces total.

Unlike in Phil Sabin's Eastern Front, rivers and hills/mountains *are* specified. At such a small scale, the Sea of Azov had to be tortured to fit, but all the surrounding areas/hexes relate properly, so .... (It *could* be done ... sort of ... Phil! :) )

Very adaptable to fast, easy solitaire play, as obviously as problems arise for both sides.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Cantaloop: Book 3 – Revenge, Served Warm
Cantaloop: Buch 3 – Rache warm serviert
boardgame.description:
You got a plan and a team! Part 3 of the Cantaloop trilogy continuous exactly where "A hack of a plan" ended. "Hook", "Fly" and Alice are ready to execute their plan against the biggest crook of town. Use the unique abilities of your team and finally get your well deserved revenge. A dish, best served warm... wait, no. Wasn't it cold!? Explore beautifully illustrated locations, talk to characters and solve tricky puzzles in this "Point'n'Click" like game. Search and collect items, figure out where to use them and combine them with each other. Do you have what it takes? Find out in Cantaloop - An interactive adventure book!

--description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

boardgame.name: Munchkin Apocalypse: Kaiju
boardgame.description:
Enjoy nuclear-powered battles, city-stomping showdowns, and off-planet altercations with Munchkin Apocalypse: Kaiju. Get barbecued by Hamera, take a sledgehammer to Rocky Road Dan, and win the day with the help of a Rousing Theme Song and a Small Child in Shorts.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Munchkin Apocalypse Kaiju Expansion

boardgame.name: Dread Fort
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A setting ~ In the Land of Magic roves a mysterious mountain fort. The spirit of a location, exhumed from the black soul of the first Dream Knight, drop this randomly appearing location into your landscape. Inspired by and in fact some phrases taken from the hallucinatory poetry of Henri Michaux, the tables are meant to stimulate a dark dreamscape for the PCs to explore. It is also a piece of lore, a rumor, a whispered nightmare that inhabits the minds of some...

boardgame.name: Sunset Delirium
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You ever have those dreams where you're like, "Haha, it's so nice to hang out with my friends and play games in person!" No? Just me? Well, Sunset Delirium is a super lightweight rpg for just that! I miss people... Using the "Powered by the Apocalypse" system, take an hour or two, make some junk up and have fun with your friends!

Either on your own, or with some friends, take turns envisioning a world and exploring it with some characters as if walking through a dream.

Make it all up or use some ideas from the right column. Envision settings, characters you meet, and conflicts. Take turns elaborating on it all.

boardgame.name: The Beast of Adredan
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Will your party claim victory over the Beast?
The people of Adredan are hunted by an abominable Beast. It stalks their island at night, destroying their homes and stealing them from their hiding places as they cower in fear.

None have stood against the Beast and lived. Will your party be the first to claim victory and free the people of Adredan?

boardgame.name: Агенты: Щит и меч
boardgame.description:
Cold War. You are in charge of foreign intelligence for one of four countries in protracted conflict. It is you who are the invisible force that the state uses when it is necessary to resolve the issue quietly. A difficult task falls on your shoulders, for the implementation of which you must use the most sophisticated techniques. Expanding the intelligence network is a kind of art ... Brute force, surveillance, blackmail, propaganda, bribery are just a small part of your arsenal. After all, the end justifies the means, especially when the interests of the state are at stake. And you also know for sure that all the links in your chain: informants, operatives and diplomats must work harmoniously, and only then will you achieve your goal.
Place your spies in different parts of the world, introduce reconnaissance of rivals, eliminate enemy agents, complete secret missions and get victory points for all these actions. The first player to reach five Victory Points is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Martian Merchants
boardgame.description:
A Looney Pyramids pickup-and-deliver puzzle game

As interplanetary merchants, shipping and trading goods throughout the galaxy, you race to be the first to bring desired goods back to the inhabitants of your home planets.

Large pyramids represent planets, which form the planetary navigational grid on the playing area. Ships travel between adjacent planets on the grid, which expands as more planets are discovered. The planets of your color are your home planets.
Medium pyramids are ships, which you use to travel from planet to planet making deliveries and establishing stations. You control three ships of your own color.
Small pyramids are goods, which are the commodities being picked up and delivered by your ships. The inhabitants of each planet desire goods of their planet’s own color. When you deliver a good to each of your home planets, you establish stations there.
The object of the game is to be the first player to establish 3 stations, one at each of your home planets.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019 from Arcane Wonders.

Discard this card at any time to take 5 Dragonscales from the Hoard and then distribute them as you wish amongst any number of players.

boardgame.name: The Witch, The Wolf & the Wedding: A Story Telling RPG
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.





The Witch, The Wolf & the Wedding is primarily about storytelling. After picking the Players' role and who will Narrate, the beginning of the story is decided mutually between them. Once this has been established, the Narrator sets a task for the Players with a 3 day deadline.Each day, Players will attempt to complete the task they have been laid. Additionally, the Narrator will set up a barrier to their completing it. The Players may call on one power every day to assist them with overcoming the barrier. If Players fail that day, it does not mean they will not succeed the next, but it does mean the task will become harder to complete.

After the days, there are the nights, when things in the woods come out to aid... or hinder.

The game requires the rules, a pencil and paper, pawns, and tokens. These represent your power in story telling. The tokens give power through their number, but the pawns represent a power by the Players beyond their normal physical abilities. These can be traded for automatic wins over where the story goes- but once they are used, they may not be called on again during that tale.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jmyales/the-witch-the-w...

boardgame.name: Drop Racer Battles
boardgame.description:
In the future, the most coveted sports prize is the Golden Drop Trophy. To win it, drop racers from around the world gear up their cars with deadly weapons and enter the Drop Arena. If a Racer can get the most drops in the Arena, they win. They have to watch out though, because cannons, lasers, and more will be aimed at them to try to take away their chance for victory. Do you have what it takes to be the next Drop Racer champion? Welcome to Drop Racer Battles!

Drop Racer Battles is a quick-playing dexterity game about flicking race cars on the table, collecting drops, and using weapons on your car to snatch victory from your opponents. The player with the most drops at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Horror Trivia
boardgame.description:
150 game cards, each featuring two horror film trivia questions (with answers on the back) and one of five weapon icons in the corner.

A trivia question is read from the card and the currently active team attempts to answer. If successful, the next question is read and they attempt to answer it also. If both answers were correct, they collect the card. Play passes to the next team.
The first team that collects 3 different weapons wins the game!
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Horror Trivia Part II: Deeper Cuts
Horror Trivia Part II: Deeper Cuts

boardgame.name: The Duck Crusade / Duck Hunt
boardgame.description:
The Duck Crusade features a one-shot OpenQuest adventure (broadly compatible with other D100 systems, Mythras etc.) with premade characters. Play angry Medieval themed Metal Ducks vs corrupt cultists!


Duck Hunt presents the Duck Crusade from the perspective of the corrupt Cultists of Grogzilla, of which there will be six premade characters.

---

The Groglands Gazeeter + Map Includes and expands the locations mentioned in The Duck Crusade and includes new locations not part of the adventure

The Kickstarter

boardgame.name: The Observatory of Tys
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A pocket sphere about piratical astronomers and their moon home.

boardgame.name: Tiny Beasts in a Vast Forest
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Troika! sphere of tiny woodland creatures ready to go on grand adventures. The two pages of this PDF can be printed separately as a Players' Guide / Referee's Guide situation, or back-to-back as a book with a second book hidden inside.

boardgame.name: 4 Squared Card Game
boardgame.description:
4 Squared is a simple game with mechanics akin to the classic Connect Four while pulling from the popular neon color palettes of the 80's!

The goal of 4 Squared is to be the first player to create a square of the color you have drawn before any of the other players; be it by brute-force, with cunning, deception, luck, or logic! You do this by out-playing your opponents and placing your 4 Squared cards with a matching color and position on top of other cards within the 4 x 4 square play area.

A typical round of 4 Squared is about 10 minutes long and can be played with anywhere between 2-4 players, each with their own hand of three cards!

4 Squared also has variations in it's base rule set that allows other ways to play!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Magical Girls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Magical Girls are often part of an ‘ancient’ group - knowingly or not. In Mariann: Soul Detective, we introduce the ‘ancient’ group of the SOUL DETECTIVES. But we didn’t go into detail about this group, because we want the Soul Detectives to match with your idea of an ancient group that protects the balance between the living and the departed! The group is what you make of it!

boardgame.name: ヒロイ ン Hiroin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hiroin is a journey inspired by the worlds created by Studio Ghibli, most notably the worlds created in the five movies NAUSICAÄ, PRINCESS MONONOKE, ARRIETTY, CASTLE IN THE SKY and PONYO.

Throughout the game, you will play through five chapters in which you will grow and learn more about yourself - something that is deeply ingrained in the philosophy of the work of Studio Ghibli. You will interact with a world of wonder and you will overcome challenges that will leave their mark.
...
This game uses the Element Dice System, which is build on the east-asian philosophy of the 5 powers or elements. The system is mainly built on ideas put forth in Taoist texts of Laozi and Zhuangzi, but has also influences from thoughts that predate these writers and from early Confucianism.

Hiroin, just as many lead characters of the Ghibli movies we love is female presenting - and the five chapters are the journey of our heroine to become a Guardian.

Hiroin is a Fan-Product and my love letter to Ghibli! But it is not a Ghibli game!

boardgame.name: Dragonhearts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You get to be a dragon

You get to kiss dragons

Need I say more? This Tabletop RPG is about about the clash of over-sized personalities between shapeshifters who can assume human or dragon form, or anything in between. It's a GMless—meaning everyone has equal narrative authority—and plays best over one or two 3-4 hour sessions, with 3-4 players.
...
Dragonhearts is made of several small scene types you play for different situations, like if you want to have big cool dragon duels At Each Other's Throats — which may at any moment become liaisons In Each Other's Arms — or change the entire world during Endgame: The Eclipse. Or, more importantly, you can have A Dance!

User summary:

Dragonhearts includes several "scene types", which are presented as games for a limited number of participants, including:


A Fractal Dream
Ritual at the Sky Mountain
A Dance
A Conversation Over Food
A Demonstration of Skill and Generosity
A Pursuit
At Each Other's Throats
In Each Other's Arms
Endgame: The Eclipse

boardgame.name: Foil Intellect and Spores
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sacred fruiting bodies displaced into profane spheres... shining men perpetually pursuant.

A Background and their nemesis

boardgame.name: Chute: La Parrilla F.C.
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the hot city of “Las Brasas” where there is nothing better than the smell of a large grill full of the best cuts of meat to feed a group of friends addicted to playing football. This is well known to Barry Mac, the coach of “La Parrilla F.C” who takes care to keep the barbecue at full fire during the 90 minutes of the game, filling his squad with football spirit.

In your deck of La Parrilla F.C you will find everything you need to feed your team with good cuts and soccer skills. Strategically, use coal and meat cards to improve your players. Knowing when to keep an active meat menu is essential, it is all in the handling of coal.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Bienvenidos a la caliente ciudad de “Las Brasas” donde no hay nada mejor que el olor de una gran parrilla llena de los mejores cortes de carne para alimentar a un grupo de amigos adictos a jugar al balonpié. Esto lo sabe muy bien Barry Mac, el DT de La Parrilla F.C que se preocupa de mantener el asado a todo fuego durante los 90 minutos de partido, llenando de espíritu futbolero a su plantel.

En tu mazo de La Parrilla F.C encontrarás todo lo necesario para alimentar a tu plantel de buenos cortes y habilidades futboleras. Utiliza estratégicamente el carbón y las cartas de carne para mejorar a tus jugadores. Saber cuando mantener una carta de carne activa es fundamental, está todo en el manejo del carbón.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Forged Ties
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forged Ties is a tabletop roleplaying rule set for action-adventure games powered by the bonds our characters forge with the world and those within it.

Play with a game runner and a handful of players in whichever module you choose, or create your own. Play for a couple sessions or play an extended game.

boardgame.name: Chute: Sportivo La Polpetta
boardgame.description:
Directly from the province of Bigoli, the “Chutemundo” welcomes the darkest and most rude characters seen so far in the league. From practices that border on the illegal, they bring with them a defensive, treacherous and threatening strategy. While their link to the mob is unconfirmed, they don't go out of their way to prove their innocence.

Sportivo La Polpetta presents you with a series of new special actions and items that you can use to gain advantages over the rival team. With an emphasis on defense, you can tailor your strategy to contain your opponent's attack and score at the right time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Directamente desde la provincia de Bigoli, se unen al Chutemundo los personajes mas sombríos y rudos vistos hasta el momento en la liga. De prácticas que bordean lo ilegal traen consigo una estrategia defensiva, traicionera y amenazante. Si bien su vínculo a la mafia no está confirmado, no se esfuerzan por demostrar su inocencia.

Sportivo La Polpetta te presenta una seria de nuevas acciones especiales y objetos que puedes utilizar para ganar ventajas sobre el equipo rival. Con un énfasis en el aspecto defensivo, puedes adaptar tu estrategia para contener el ataque del adversario y atacar en el momento preciso. A continuación te damos a conocer el funcionamiento dealgunas de las nuevas cartas.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Forged on the High Seas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forged on the High Seas is a sea-faring, treasure hunting, and mythical adventure module.

boardgame.name: Chute: Atlético Pantera
boardgame.description:
Agile, fast and fearless. From Narang, the first women's team comes to the League. It is Atlético Pantera, that with a wild and daring approach proposes to revolutionize the “Chutemundo”. Meet these warriors trained by nature itself, ready to demonstrate their skills on the field of play.

With this expansion you will be able to modify the court with the new "Jungle" cards that will help your players to move and improve their skills. Use them in the correct spaces to weaken your opponent and boost your squad.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ágiles, veloces e intrépidas. Desde Narang, llega el primer equipo femenino a la Liga. Se trata de Atlético Pantera que con un planteamiento selvático y atrevido propone revolucionar el Chutemundo. Conoce a estas guerreras entrenadas por la naturaleza misma, listas para demostrar sus destrezas en el campo de juego.

Con este mazo podrás modificar la cancha con las novedosas cartas de “Selva” que ayudarán a tus jugadoras a moverse y mejorar sus habilidades. Úsalas en los espacios correctos para debilitar a tu rival y potenciar a tu plantel.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chute: La Perla United
boardgame.description:
All hands on deck! is heard at full volume through a large megaphone in “Laguna Carnada” on match days. Accustomed to the harsh life on the high seas, the “La Perla United” squad brings a powerful maritime strategy to the “Chutemundo”. Ready your cannons and ignite the gunpowder of this team full of ruffians and mercenaries ready for battle.

La Perla United is distinguished by its tricks of skilled pirates and wise sailors. Their time at sea has made them rough, and they have discovered how to control the most powerful creature in the depths… the Kraken!!! use it to score and destroy your rivals with his unique skills. It is not an easy task, but the reward of summoning him is gigantic.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Todos a sus puestos! se escucha a todo volumen por un gran megáfono en Laguna Carnada los días de partido. Acostumbrados a la dura vida en alta mar, el plantel de La Perla United trae al Chutemundo una estrategia marítima potente, alista tus cañones y enciende la pólvora de este equipo lleno de rufianes y mercenarios listos para la batalla.

La Perla United se distingue por sus trucos de piratas hábiles y sabios navegantes. Su tiempo en el mar los ha convertido en discípulos de éste y han descubierto como controlar a la criatura mas poderosa de las profundidades, descubre al “Kraken” y úsalo para destruir a tu rival. No es tarea fácil, pero la recompensa es gigantezca.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Instant Air Hockey
boardgame.description: Play Air-powered hockey on nearly any table with this game. The set includes two nets with suction cups to secure the goals, two hand-held paddles for shooting and blocking the puck, and one battery-operated foam puck that floats on a cushion on air. Play on any table or flat surface. The player who scores the most goals within an agreed upon period of time wins!

boardgame.name: Warfleets: FTL
boardgame.description:
Warfleets: FTL is a miniature wargame set in a distant galaxy at war, designed for spaceships of all scales. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging spaceship battles for new and experienced players alike.

The game is played with 10-15 models per fleet.
Players put together a fleet and fight to secure and retrieve objective markers, using battlefleet tactics to win. The game features alternating ship phases and brutally quick combat, keeping both players engaged at all times.
Turn Sequence:
1. Squadrons Phase
2. Light Ships Phase
3. Medium Ships Phase
4. Heavy Ships Phase

This rulebook adds lots of extra content to the core rules, providing you with countless hours of epic spaceship battles that you can customize however you like. The rules are written to be concise and to the point, and come with beautiful illustrations as well as helpful example diagrams.

Here's everything that's included in this rulebook:

Core Rules
Advanced Rules
Terrain Placement
Deployment Styles
Extra Missions
Boarding Actions
Random Events
Battlefield Conditions
Terrain & Objective Effects

Total Conversions
Fog of War
Catastrophic Damage
Order Dice
Ordnance Tokens
Command Dials
Shields & Defensive Tokens
Scanner Ranges
Planetary Control
Multiplayer Games
Kitchen Table Games



Note that the factions book is available for free on the publisher website, and is not part of this rulebook. If any updates are made to the rules, then the online version of the rulebook will also be updated.

boardgame.name: Bear the Lode
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Putting an end to strange disturbances plaguing a mining operation is all in a day’s work for an adventurer, but is the job as straightforward as it seems, or is there more than meets the eye?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Codex Fantasia: Dominus Duodecim
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inject over-the-top, anime-style action into your adventures with this collection of subclasses, spells, feats and maneuvers!

Inspired by the aesthetics and tropes of anime, manga and video games, Codex Fantasia: Dominus Duodecim promises to enliven the gaming experience of players looking to better realise their anime-esque fantasies in more tangible and satisfying mechanical terms, whether they’re grapple-slinging giant-slayers or grand summoners calling awesome allies to their side.

boardgame.name: The Machiavelli
boardgame.description:
The king has died and with only the twin princes remaining, both have claim to the crown, which means its time for internal war!

The Machiavelli is an abstract two player board game where you must place and then move your pieces to either form a lign of 5 of your 6 pieces or flank the enemy prince with two of your pieces in order to depose him and become the new king.

This game is one that may be quick and simple to learn however through gameplay you may find it's difficult to master due to the verity of different play styles and combinations you can experience in the quick yet intense matches you play against your friends and foes

Inspired by many ancient games such as nine men's morris among others this game would not be out of place amongst rowdy tavern goers or stern military generals and soldiers.

boardgame.name: Mindless Digging
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shortly after the party steps foot into Termalaine they meet a Kobold who is frantically trying to find some help. They spot the party and ask the party to help his workers who uncovered something in a mine that is affecting the mind of the other kobolds.

Made as a tier 1 adventure with APL 1 for the Adventure League's Dungeon Craft season 10 Plague of Ancients and uses the adventure seed (In Too Deep).
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Antenna TV Opoly
boardgame.description:
A monopoly like game with properties that feature TV shows that air on Antenna TV.

Unique tokens include: Clock Tower, Mailman, Ferris Wheel, Jukebox, Cowboy Hat, and Convertible.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

listing.notes: Game is in excellent condition and has been verified as complete including original instructions which are printed on the box insert. Deck of cards, bag with the houses/hotels, and the bag with the tokens/dice are still sealed. Box has light storage wear but overall the box is in very good condition. Plastic storage tray/box insert is also present.

boardgame.name: Climate Change 2030: The Tile Game
boardgame.description:
A safe and just space on Earth is the ring between an environmental ceiling and a social foundation. The conditions affecting the ceiling and the foundation shift and change during game play.

Mitigate conditions, with hidden objective cards, to make a safe and just space on Earth by making sets and controlling areas to score the most points.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Climate Change 2030: Running out of Time
boardgame.description:
The year is 2021. Climate change is felt by many. The Earth is ravaged, and the people lack basic necessities. Can you create a Safe and Just space on Earth before the point of no return.

During each of ten turns from 2021 to 2030, you'll use a set of 5 mitigation cards to mitigate environmental or social conditions and to expand your research lab.

The cards and the lab allow you to remove 'danger' blocks and install 'protection' blocks from 11 conditions on the Safe and Just Doughnut Board.

At the end of 2030, you need to have removed all of the red blocks and installed all of the green blocks for the best win scenario, but beware, every year catastrophe can add more red blocks.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Disney Tsum Tsum Stacking Dice Game
boardgame.description:
This is a stacking game with characters from the Disney franchise.

There are two versions of this game. The First version is aimed for kids who are 6+. Place all blue-edged cards face up. To play this version of the game the player rolls 3 dice (up to 3 times) until they get a pair and a star, or if you roll 3 stars; afterwards the player stacks the dice in the form of a triangle. The same player can then take 3 cards from the deck or another player.

The one with the most points wins!

The 8+ version is kind of similar except you use all the coloured cards.
there is also a card element

boardgame.name: Bushido: Hikari
boardgame.description:
In life, Hikari was one of four sisters who found their shugenja abilities were amplified when they worked as a coven. The fateful night the sisters were offered a bargain with Yurei, the others readily accepted the power they would gain but Hikari stood firm and refused, knowing the bargain would never be anything but a yolk around their necks and a pathway to evil. The bargain was offered only to the whole coven so her sisters murdered her and accepted the bargain as three Yuta. Hikari is still powerfully linked to them so her sisters raised her as a Kairai and forced her to obey their commands but sometimes she finds the will to fight free.

Hikari’s unique connection to the Yuta means she offers even more flexibility to the Yuta box and, importantly she can use the Chaos Bolt Ki Feat and automatically win the opposed Ki test since she is Soulless. Choosing when to throw off her undead nature and assert control is key to making the best use of her profile.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Twin Realms
boardgame.description:
Twin Realms is a complex dungeon crawler.

Players will be controlling elemental spirits that protect the world from an army of demons. Each quest is unique and many of them have specific objectives. They are not only limited to "kill all that moves".
The combat is played in turns on a board (different for every quest) divided into squares and players will be able to perform actions using a deck of ability cards unique to each elemental spirit.
The distinct feature of the game is hinted in its name. You will be playing in two realms. Physical, and spiritual. The playable characters as well as enemies have 2 forms with different abilities in each realm. The movement will be different in each realm. And some board elements will be different between realms (imagine walls that you can pass through as a spirit but not in physical form). The combat and gameplay will be guided by the fact that you will have to switch between realms to optimize your combat abilities, to avoid enemy attacks etc.

All characters will be developed by levelling up from 1 to 10. Apart from regular upgrades to health and your ability cards you will be able to choose additional perks and choose your path in the game. You can focus on passive abilities, special system of attack modifiers, additional boosts to your cards or special rage cards. You will not be able to maximise all of the perks so every player will be able to build their character in their own way. You can build a character with a very strong set of cards less reliable on attack modifiers. You can build a character that has no upgrades on the cards but most of the attack modifiers are critical hits, burn targets, disarm them or add other status effects. You can build a character that does not focus on any of that but instead generates a ton of rage and exploits various bonuses of the rage deck.

Each character will be able to fulfil a specific role in the company based on its abilities and its build. The roles are the usual set of tanks, assassins, mages and supports. However, that only applies to the physical realm.
While in physical realm each character will try to fulfil their assigned role, in spirit realm all characters are the same, which means that in spirit realm you will share the responsibilities of dealing and taking damage. When you kill enemy spirits, you will be gathering their essence and taking over their actions to create interesting combat situations.

The game takes place in a unique world not long after its creation. There are no humans, dwarves, elves or any other races yet in it. The elementals and the demons are being led by primordial forces of good and evil. As you progress through the game you will learn more about the mythology of this world and what role you play in the history of things.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bushido: Miyakomo Korra
boardgame.description:
Daughters of the Waves, Sea Witches, Miyakomo sisters… known by many names these shugenja are some of the Jung’s most important allies. The very waves are Korra’s to command and she mercilessly batters her enemies with tide and waves.

Miyakomo's ability to move enemy models like the tides is very useful and combined with Fog of Hesitation, she is a powerful control piece; able to dictate where and when the Jung engage their enemies.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bushido: Moyasu
boardgame.description:
Moyasu was cursed to burn forever without being consumed. She was offered respite under the ocean by the sea Kami but any part of her that extends above the waves bursts into flames! Like others with the blessing of the sea Kami, she has taken on some aspects of sea creatures.

On the table Moyasu requires a delicate balance as she can be as dangerous to your own models as the enemy, much like fire used as a weapon at sea. Her ability to hold a model in place while giving out many fire markers makes for a very powerful effect, if you can position her well.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bushido: Ryujin – Spirit of the Deep
boardgame.description:
Ryujin is the Spirit of the Deep Ocean, one of the most powerful Kami in the Jwar Isles. It is rumoured that the very act of calling him forth caused the tsunami that devastated the region. All lesser water Kami are his to command and in some ways are part of him. The Sea Witches of the Jung have bound him to a form of a great water serpent and he has blessed them with his aid. Bushido’s biggest model does not disappoint on the table! With his Tsunami and Incoming Tide abilities, Ryujin affects the game without making an attack but he also has powerful melee and ranged abilities. Finally, he has the Believer ability for Miyakomo models making their Ki Feats considerably more efficient.

Box contains one 98mm tall miniature supplied with integrated base and one full colour card. Product is multi part and assembly is required.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bushido: Axiam
boardgame.description:
Axiam is a Jonin or “High Man” in the Shadow Wind Clan. He has proven greater than the Shadow Crows and now teaches those who would be North Star Ninja. Still some missions must be overseen by more experienced hands and Axiam shows why he is fit to teach the next generation with his prodigious skill. In the game Axiam has high melee skill, rare among ninjas and the only North Star model to have such high base statistic. His range of abilities is unparalleled as he can use any Feat of any North Star Ninja. He adds to this unpredictability with his Equipment rule allowing you to choose an Equipment Card mid game to suit the exact
circumstances you are in.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadow Tactics: Ronin expansion
boardgame.description:
Ronin is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion to Shadow Tactics - The Board Game that gives solo and cooperative modes to the game.
In this mode the Daimyo player is replaced by an automated rules system, relying on different types of actions with specific dice to roll.

There are several Daimyo actions like moving or defending a target, deployment, or roll call, that could be some potential tactics of a human Daimyo player. There are certain actions when the guards' movement very directly depends on what actions the ninjas actually programmed during that turn, so you have to make your plans very carefully and in close cooperation.

boardgame.name: Pokémon Jr. Adventure Game: Pokémon Emergency!
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box:
In this game, you and your friends become Pokémon trailers and set out on a series of exciting adventures. Journey from Pallet Town to Viridian City, looking for Pokémon to capture and battles to win! With each story-game you play, you and your friends collect Pokémon and gain experience in your quest to become Pokémon masters.

boardgame.name: Evensong
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The brazen kidnapping of a famous singer draws the heroes into the latest act of a drama begun 150 years prior, when the dread pirate Cervantes Diabolique cut a swath of terror through the sector. The legendary hoard he left behind has never been found, but it’s now thew focus of the latest search by those who would do anything to possess it. Can the adventurers stop the plot, or will they become more victims of a long-dead buccaneer?

Evensong is a short adventure for Cepheus Engine (CE) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: The Markoss Dossier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The planet Tymersin is ruled by the despot Markoss V, a long-lost heir to the throne that popped up sometime after the last war between the interstellar government and its rival. But the story doesn’t quite add up with a historical researcher who’s convinced that Markoss’ origins are not as they’ve been portrayed and obtains the proof. But the data goes missing and it’s up to the PCs to locate and make sure the researcher gets hold of it. They quickly find themselves in a race against time versus the tyrant’s state security service and a mysterious figure who’s willing to do whatever it takes to complete their mission.

The Markoss Dossier is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: A Lapidary of Wond'rous Stones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

People of older times believed that gemstones and minerals had power, without even having to be enchanted. These properties were laid out in a 'Lapidary'. This booklet collates these ideas and makes suggestions for their use in OSR or D&D style games.

boardgame.name: Dom Pierre
boardgame.description:
At the end of the 17th century, a French Benedictine monk in charge of the cellar at Hautvillers Abbey made an important contribution to differentiate wines from that region. As a result, it became possible to produce wines of superior quality, particularly in white wines made from black grape varieties. While Dom Pierre Pérignon initially felt the sparkling of the wine was a negative feature, the consequent increase in both quality and quantity created the path that lead to the appreciation and recognition of champagne.

Throughout the 18th century, several "champagne houses" — or Champagne Maisons — were founded, and a new business dynamic grew in the region. These houses replaced small farm and monastery production in leading the evolutionary process of champagne, and by planting more vineyards or buying grapes from other producers or both, they mastered the specialization. To promote their product, the houses hired sales agents to take samples of their champagne wines to the Royal Courts of Europe, a crucial factor in generating the glamorous fashion of drinking champagne.

Despite production growth, improved quality, and increasing popularity, trade did not reach spectacular rates during the 19th century — which is why the game Dom Pierre is much more about winning prestige than earning money. In the game, you are responsible for one of the oldest Champagne Maisons, producing and selling wine all over Europe, not to mention the other side of the Atlantic. The local economy will be boosted, employment increased, and your brand will become universally recognized.

To make all this happen will require a chain of actions that starts in your vineyard. You will need to look for continuous improvement, constantly react to your opponents, and optimize your choices to build the most prestigious Champagne Maison. In game terms, on a turn you move up a disc on the winery game board and perform an action, with the actions become more powerful as the game progresses. You will plant in the vineyards, harvest crops, buy grapes from neighbors, make wines in your cellar (some more valuable than others), allocate salespeople on four market routes and workers in the vineyard and cellar, and acquire the necessary accessories to improve production.

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Moloch the Beginning
boardgame.description:
Moloch the Beginning Campaign is a two-player expansion for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. It depicts the beginning of humanity’s fight with the rebellious artificial intelligence, Moloch. The first months on the battlefield are pure madness, which means that even one insignificant soldier or bad day could lead to mission failure!

The campaign is a two-player game consisting of five consecutive missions. At the beginning, players must choose a Faction — Moloch or Outpost — that they will lead through the entire campaign. Each mission consists of special rules that change the gameplay of the Mission.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Schism: Immolation of Oethenfur
boardgame.description:
Take control of the faction of your choosing and go toe-to-toe against your friends. You’ll have to be cunning and quick to win victory. Build your own unique battle terrain with Tiles for a BRAWL battle, CLASH, or KING OF THE HILL. The game ends when one player claims victory by defeating all enemy Champions, or after 10 rounds.

Schism is easy to learn, has endless strategic possibilities, and has high quality miniatures that are ready to paint if you’re a miniature painting enthusiast!

Schism is the fast-paced table top Skirmisher for 2 to 4 players from Arcanist Entertainment, designed to be quick and easy to learn even for complete beginners to the genre.


Choose a champion to ACTIVATE
MOVE a number of Hex equal to their movement stat
ATTACK
END TURN


—description from the publisher

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P0kv7wOJvtw

boardgame.name: Grogzilla (Issue 1 - Feb 2020)
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Grogzilla, a zine to celebrate Grogmeet 2019, a convention held annually in Manchester, organised by the staff of the Grognard Files Podcast.

It was further ‘enhanced’ by a ZineQuest 2 Kickstarter in Feb 2020.

Within these pages, you will find a little bit of
what D101 Games does.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: I Don't Think We Are In Atlantis Any More
The Imperial Ysian Tourist Boards Top Ten Sights of the Empire
The Weird and the Warped Part 2

boardgame.name: Swords Against the Shroud
boardgame.description:
Swords Against the Shroud is a Swords and Sorcery Role-Playing Game (S&S RPG). The players play genre-focused characters, Barbarians, Fighters, Thieves and Sorcerers, exploring the dying world of Zarth. A a world that is subject to not only the worst effects of human greed and corruption but also the unwelcome attention of the demonic Others who come through the Shroud that separates Zarth from the hellish Other Worlds, to feed on pain and misery.

This book is Crypts and Things remade with The Black Hack 2nd Edition, an exciting fast-moving concise modern d20 fantasy ruleset that models old school play.

In 86 A5 pages this self-contained rules book contains:


Introduction
Character Generation.
Rules for Everyone.
Rules for the Players.
Rules for the Referee.
The Halls of Nizur Thun.
A Character Sheet
A Referee’s Log


Publisher Blurb via DriveThruRPG

boardgame.name: 紅茶ロマン紀行 (Romantic Tea Trip)
boardgame.description:
Romantic Tea Trip is set in early modern England. You are a merchant who trades in black tea. Make your business a success by growing black tea around the world, such as Darjeeling and Assam, and promoting new methods of drinking tea, such as Earl Grey and the use of tea bags!

Your goal is to become the King of Tea.

In this game, you move your rabbit piece forward one to three steps and perform the effects of the card you land on to collect Tea Chests or increase the value of the Tea Chests you already have.

You use Tea Chests you have collected in this way to acquire cards. The victory points awarded are written on the acquired cards; the first player to reach 100 points is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)

boardgame.name: Under Hollow Hills
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter campaign:

A tabletop roleplaying game about a traveling circus under the Hollow Hills. Enchantment, drama, and dangerous secrets revealed to all.

boardgame.name: ASL Action Pack #16: From the Land Down Under
boardgame.description:
Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under features a new map (15a/b) and 15 new scenarios designed and playtested by the Australian ASL community. Spearheaded by Andrew Rogers (Hatten In Flames), the scenarios of Action Pack #16 feature actions and combatants from all around the globe.

Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under contains:
one new 11" x 16" double-sided ASL mapboard (15a/b)
15 new ASL scenarios (AP160-AP174):

AP160 Carrier Hill – 6 turns, 22 April 1941, Tobruk, Libya
AP161 ANZAC Boys – 5 turns, 27 May 1941, Chania, Crete
AP162 The Governor – 4½ turns, 19 June 1941, Merdjayoun, Syria
AP163 Dingoes At Damour – 5½ turns, 9 July 1941, Damour, Syria
AP164 Sparrow Force – 5½ turns, 22 February 1942, Oesau, West Timor
AP165 The Chocos – 4½ turns, 26 July 1942, Oivi, New Guinea
AP166 Aussie Alamo – 6½ turns, 28 January 1943, Wandumi, New Guinea
AP167 All The King’s Enemies – 5½ turns, 30 January 1943, Wau, New Guinea
AP168 Nameless Hill – 5 turns, 30 December 1943, Razorback Ridge, New Britain
AP169 The Beasts Have Arrived – 5½ turns, 16 April 1944, Seredynki, Ukraine
AP170 Never On Time – 6 turns, 28 June 1944, Mouen, France
AP171 Pössl’s Posse – 5½ turns, 12 July 1944, Kaunas, Lithuania
AP172 Hickory Lickin’ – 5½ turns, 16 October 1944, Würselen, Germany
AP173 The Bend – 4½ turns, 16 January 1945, Hatten, France
AP174 Forest Gumm – 5½ turns, 19 January 1945, Weyersheim, France

Designed for the aficionado, Action Pack #16: From The Land Down Under is not a complete product and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.

-description from publisher's website

I'm the owner of Wargame Depot so a purchase from me will always be packed professionally and I can accept Paypal, MO/Check, or MC/Visa/Discover/AMEX.
And if you want this game plus anything else that I am selling on BGG, I'll of course be happy to add other items to your package. Just let me know.
North Carolina residents pay 7% sales tax.
Cheers, Jason

boardgame.name: Skyraiders of the Floating Realms Zero Edition
boardgame.description:
What this Zero Edition Contains

A fuller version of the game is coming later this year, but this Zero Edition gets you up and gaming in the Floating Realms, with the following chapters.

1. Characters
This chapter details how to create and improve the adventurers. It is intended as a one-stop-shop for everything the players need to know about their alter-egos in the Floating Realms.

2. How to do Things
This chapter deals with the percentile-based skill system that the game uses. Small and compact, it allows both the players and the Referee quickly resolve whether the
characters succeed at what they are attempting when the outcome of their actions is unclear.

3. How to Fight
A closer look at what happens when the characters end up fighting their opponents. Skyraiders combat is quick and furious and models the swashbuckling antics of its combatants.

4. How to do Magic
In the Floating Realms, everyone can do a bit of magic. This chapter explains how and gives a shortlist of magic spells. It also explains how magic items work.

5. Organisations
Despite the fractured nature of the Floating Realms, there are many organisations which the characters can join to learn magic and power.

6. Monsters
This chapter explains how to create monsters for your adventures and has a couple of examples.

7. Adventure: The Edge of the World
While other games go dungeon delving or telling some great contrived story of the main characters, Skyraiders comes from a simpler time of journeys across fantastic
lands, were the adventurers encounter events in locations and then move on to the next encounter location, rather than get stuck down the dungeon.
The Edge of the World is such an adventure, where the adventurers must deal with the fact that their current home sky island is disappearing.

publisher blurb - via DriveThruRPG

boardgame.name: Masters Campaign Content Catalogue
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Masters campaign is intended for those invested players with some experience with the D&D Adventurers League. As such, you can join with the Masters campaign with any Seasonal or Historic campaign D&D Adventurers League character that has reached 5th-level. A character that has migrated from the Seasonal campaign to the Historic campaign may not later choose to migrate to the Masters campaign. Once a character has chosen to migrate to the Masters campaign, they may no longer participate in Seasonal or Historic campaign adventures.
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Masters Campaign Player's Guide: Dreams of the Red Wizards
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

DO YOU LOVE DUNGEONS & DRAGONS?

We certainly do! The D&D Adventurers League welcomes anyone and everyone to join us at the game table, whether it’s in-person or online. We’re a diverse and inclusive group, so no matter who you are, if you love D&D, you’re ONE OF US!

D&D ADVENTURERS LEAGUE HOUSE RULES

Nearly every D&D game has house rules that modify or clarify the existing rules as they pertain to that Dungeon Master’s game. To maintain fairness for all participants in a shared-world campaign, all DMs use the same house rules.

What follows are the house rules for play in the D&D Adventurers League Forgotten Realms Masters campaign. As the campaign continues, we’ll modify these living rules as needed.
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: ViceVersi
boardgame.description:
ViceVersi is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. You can play it immediately if you have Othello/Reversi.

As setup, arrange 64 double faced disks as the checkers pattern (as the diagram above). The object is to connect all your color orthogonally on the board.

GAMEPLAY
At first, white choose a disk facing black color up and flip it over.
Then black takes turn and from then on, players alternate turns taking one of two action below.

(1. Choose a pair of disks with opponent’s color facing up that are orthogonally sandwiching one of your color disk or an unbroken line of your color disks, flip them over to friendly color. You may not divide an opponent’s group to two or more groups by this action, unless it makes your winning condition.

(2. Choose a disk with your color facing up, flip it over to opponent’s color. It is required the target disk is not a part of your largest group, and adjacent the largest group of opponent’s color.

If both players achieve the winning condition simultaneously, the turn player wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Adventurers League Dungeon Master's Guide (Plague of Ancients)
boardgame.description:
A Campaign Supporting Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

From the introduction:

This document is a guide to getting started as a Dungeon Master (DM) for the Forgotten Realms D&D Adventurers League campaign featuring ICEWIND DALE: RIME OF THE FROSTMAIDEN. These rules are supplemented by the Seasonal Campaign versions of the Adventurers League FAQ, the Adventurers League Player’s Guide, and the Adventurers League Content Catalogue.

boardgame.name: Folklore: The Affliction – Grey Mini Pack
boardgame.description:
This was a promotional item for their 1st KS which included 15 miniatures for Folklore: The Affliction in grey plastic.

Includes:

1 Abomination
1 Dark Oak
1 Decaying Dead
1 Flesh Eating Ghoul
2 Gargoyle
1 Mad Druid
2 Night Stalker
2 Rabid Wolf
2 Vampire
2 Werewolf
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Folklore: The Affliction – Dark Tales Expansion

boardgame.name: Myraclia: LUNA
boardgame.description:
Harvest the energy only the universe can provide.
But everything precious comes with a price...

- - -

Consisting only of a drafting board extension and shiny cube, Luna may appear gimmicky at the first glance. But this single chunk of metal holds divine powers never seen before. It adds to an already tense drafting mechanism precious Element everybody craves for that tests the will and self-restraint to their limits.

Compatible with Eternity and Darkness expansions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: TV Canal 1
boardgame.description:
From the box:
Have you ever thought how fantastic the life of a television executive is?
Taking care of programs, messing with schedules, finding creative solutions is undoubtedly a fascinating activity!
That's why you'll like TV CHANNEL 1! In this game you will experience all the emotions that govern the life of a TV channel! Play a game! And have real fun!

The players are in charge of one of the TB stations that competed in São Paulo, in 1975 (Cultura, Tupi, Globo, Record, Gazeta and Bandeirantes). Each turn, players buy TV shows and decide if they want to produce and fit them in their grid or keep in their archive. The audience rating of a particular TV show will determine the amount of cash each player will receive. After that, the players will change their grid, archiving some shows or selling them.

The player with more money at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Piñata Dice
boardgame.description:
Piñata Dice is a family and competitive game where you will use your skill to collect as many candy as you can. Roll the dice and collect at full speed those that are equal to the cards in your hand to score the most points and be the winner.

The first player takes the dice and drops them to the center of the table, each player must simultaneously collect as many dice as possible that are equal to those of the cards in his hand. When all the dice are claimed from valid moves (die on a card of the same type) or no one can collect any other, the cards that have die on top are saved as VICTORY POINTS equal to the value of the card. The round ends when there are no more cards left in the main deck.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Savage Tokusatsu: When Friends Attack!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Friend Group Friction, Heroes!

Savage Tokusatsu: When Friends Attack! is a One Sheet for Savage Tokusatsu! Players take on the role of heroic teens who get caught up when a new villain shows up in town and, through a comedic series of complications, accidentally super-sizes their friend! To make matters worse, the friend has no idea that the group are the famous heroes that have been protecting the town! When the military and police step in to screw things up and escalate the problem, it's up to the heroes to minimize the damage to the town... and their friend!

Savage Tokusatsu: When Friends Attack! is perfect for kids, adults, and families looking to enjoy a lighthearted adventure of magical do-goodery! Run through all four adventures for a wonderful mini-campaign, play the first adventure as a one shot, or create your own adventures to fill out a longer campaign! There's no wrong way to play!

boardgame.name: Folklore: The Affliction – Tan Mini Pack
boardgame.description:
This was a promo during their 1st KS and it included all 70 miniatures (from Core Game and the Dark Tales expansion) in an alternate plastic (Tan). Note that this does include The Abomination.

Includes:

1 Abomination
1 Arch-Fiend
1 Bánánach
1 Far East Alchemist
1 Galastig
1 Orinthe
1 Otherian
1 Valdleany
1 Arcanist
1 Archeologist
1 Avenging Madman
1 Butcher
1 Courtesan
1 Exorcist
1 Illusionist
1 Scientist
1 Slayer
1 Telepath
1 Woodsman
1 Witch Hunter
2 Banshee
2 Dark Dryad
1 Dark Oak
4 Death Hands
2 Decaying Dead
4 Demonic Flame
2 Flesh Eating Ghoul
2 Gargoyle
2 Watchman
2 Highwayman
2 Mad Druid
2 Moon Priest
2 Night Stalker
3 Demonspawn
2 Possessed
2 Rabid Wolf
3 Restless Spirit
3 Stregha
1 Undertaker
1 Vicious Hound
2 Vampire
2 Werewolf
2 Wretched Hag
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Folklore: The Affliction – Dark Tales Expansion

boardgame.name: Fashion 101
boardgame.description:
Fashion 101 is a lightweight mix-and-match game for ages 8+ that challenges players to create outfits that match fashion themes revealed during each round of the game. You can be literal, creative, or quirky in your interpretation of any given theme—as long as you delight the "Fashion Judge," who awards style points to each winning outfit. Think of it as “Apples to Apples” with a fashion twist!

What if you don’t have the pieces in your wardrobe needed to pull off a great outfit? Play one of your “Fashion Emergency” cards to improve your collection or bamboozle other players. But be careful—timing is everything!

Fashion 101 was invented in 2017 by 10-year-old Elsa Brandt. In 2020, her mom began working with her to bring the game to fruition as a way to combat boredom and create a fun learning experience during the Covid lockdown in Seattle.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: V-Sabotage: Expansions Miniature pack
boardgame.description: Upgrade your V-Commandos expansions with miniatures, objective tiles, new commandos illustrations and more!

boardgame.name: The Miasmic Intrusion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A vile cult is trying to bring about the end times by summoning a phlegmatic god from the void. Your heroes must work quickly to battle this cult and put a stop to their miasmic intrusion into this world!

Written by Evey Lockhart for Troika!, The Miasmic Intrusion can be adapted to any old school style game. Featuring an original map by Dyson Logos, and original art by Carmin Vance, Alex Mayo, and Billiam Babble.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Weird: The Zine (Issue #1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here’s what you need to know: everything you hold precious and dear is gone. Earth is no more, just a nameless star system’s asteroid field. Humans proliferate across countless worlds and moons and artificial bodies.

Like rats.

Their Government is a mostly autonomous industrial machine buried in bureaucracy with disparate agencies operating in tandem towards similar goals, bogging down everyone in physical paperwork, outdated filing systems and grinding all social progress to a slow, barely perceptible crawl. War rages on the border against an assortment of difficult opponents— like the Tleilaxan Order and the psychosphere’s hordes, among others.

Meanwhile, the various Departments of Xeno Science and Xenological Study have “contracted” new conscripts through the government’s official mandatory employment office for exploratory missions of discovery in the Unknown Reaches: exploring new worlds, cataloging life forms and plant life, and assessing mineral composition for future colonization and government exploitation. In exchange, conscripted scientists permanent debt is partially erased and they earn credits for every novel discovery.


Beyond the Weird: The Zine is a brand new science fiction role playing game setting with a built in set of simple rules so players can immediately start playing in the harsh setting of Beyond the Weird. Players are "field scientists" -- explorers -- sent to distant, exotic worlds and left to fend for themselves as they make various 'discoveries'.

The experience can be very lethal, but new conscripts are easy to generate and drop into play.

boardgame.name: Essential Necromancy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not enough necromancy in your life? Do you feel like there aren't enough spells for a low-level necromancer? We've got you covered with twelve new spells, including spells that let you summon skeletons and specters.

This "diabolically" inspired supplement is fully compatible with 5th Edition and will have you launching bone lances, exploding corpses, and summoning minions. Open up this grimoire and enjoy the spells within!

boardgame.name: Circle of Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Summer and winter. Growth and decay. Life and death. While many if not most druids draw their power from the growing, green things of the world, there are those who embrace the other end of the natural cycle. Such druids venerate death’s position in the natural order as the great equalizer, as the inescapable ending that awaits all living things, as that which makes room for new life and new growth.

The Circle of Death druid gives you access to necromancy spells, command of undead beasts, and the ability to take on a resilient undead beast form.

boardgame.name: Power Components
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock the mysteries of altering and enhancing your cantrips with the 5e-compatible Power Components!

This supplement contains 46 new magically-charged plants, insects, and crystals that can be used to enhance cantrips and make your world feel more alive!

This supplement also contains two new water-themed cantrips as well as three necromancy cantrips that were previously published in Essential Necromancy. Two new magic items are included as well!

boardgame.name: Robocity
boardgame.description:
Program your robots and be the first to get your robots to the finish!

Each player controls four robots which are programmed each round by playing cards face-down on your board. Use energy to buy new cards, upgrade your handsize or remove cards from your deck.

Robocity adds some new twists to the deckbuilding genre: cards you buy are added to your hand and can be used immediately, a dynamic handsize, the use of powerfull - one time used - special cards and the use of resource management outside your deck in the form of energy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Snakes Magic & Ladders
boardgame.description:
Snakes Magic & Ladders is an easy, fun yet challenging board game played with 2-5 players. If you can throw the dice, you'll start playing in less than 5 minutes! The game is simple, fun and full of cool ways to beat the game! Grab a power-up and enjoy a super boost, keeping you invincible for as long as you can avoid the dangers and traps as you climb to spot 100! The more players, the more fun! You can: - Climb Ladders - Attack Other Players - Get Power-ups - and much more! Think you got what it takes to win the game by reaching spot #100 first?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Nickelodeon Six Pix
boardgame.description: Players move around a square game board a number of spaces equal to the number of differences he/she can spot from a card with two similar images. On some spaces, players may have to turn the card upside down or keep one eye closed while spotting the differences. The player who reaches the finish first wins the game.

boardgame.name: Gnome Hollow
boardgame.description:
Gnome Hollow is a strategic tile-placement/worker-placement game with area control and a weather mechanic.

Players place tiles to build mushroom circles, harvest mushrooms when it rains, and collect wild flowers. Every tile you place is an opportunity to outwit the other gnomes in the hollow. Spend your coveted mushrooms to hire worker gnomes and make claims on the best circles to increase your harvest. After each rain, your gnomes carry their bountiful harvests home and you have a chance to claim your opponents’ best circles before the next rain. As the game progresses it is as much about playing a beautiful game as it is wonderful journey to strategically outplay your opponents.

Be clever and collect every mushroom you can, because the gnome with the most mushrooms at the end of the game wins!

Every piece of Gnome Hollow is beautifully watercolored.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Backyard Chickens
boardgame.description:
Backyard Chickens is a deck-building game for two to five players in which you and your neighbors compete to raise the best flock on the block!

During your turn, you collect eggs, purchase supplies, and care for your chickens. Failing to feed and water your chickens will make them unhappy. Unhappy chickens produce fewer eggs, are worth fewer victory points and may run away.

Play continues until a player’s flock is worth ten or more points. The player with the most points wins the game!

—description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mutants in the Now
boardgame.description:
LET'S MUTATE ALL OVER AGAIN!

In the ‘80s and ‘90s, they ruled the streets, kick-flipping off of villainous faces and slipping into the shadows. Then, they vanished from the world of tabletop gaming.

But they’re back. And ready to KICK BUTT.

Mutants in the Now is a retromodern retake on the mutant animal role-playing games long past and left behind by licensing. Mutants fight to survive, thrive, and make the world better for themselves and humanity.

With well over a hundred species of animals, few mutants will be the same! Species range from the tiny earthworm to the massive whale. Play a placid pika or fierce wolverine! Everything from a common Corgi to the rare axolotl. Forge your unique existence!

Combat styles, psionic powers, and distinct backgrounds further define your chimeric character! Whether it’s the street fighting of Jailhouse Rock, the “double jumps” of Telekinetic Boosting, or being a defender of a secret enclave, there’s numerous ways to build a unique mutant all your own.

Meanwhile, conspiratorial corporations, nouveau ninja, and extradimensional evildoers are up to no good. Go on adventures from the alleyways to orbit in a modern world where the shadows are filled with strangeness.

Carve a place in the world as weird as you are!

IT'S FOR THE ANIMALS.


Words by Julian Kay (two-time ENnie-award winning freelancer; Level 99 Games, Pelgrane Press), art by Fábio Fontes (Pixel Tactics, Millennium Blades, Buck Up and Drive!) and funded through Kickstarter!
Over 130 animal species and over 200 mutation traits. Use your Genetic-Organic Optimization Points (GOO-P) to build a unique mutant!
Fourteen combat styles as traditional as Aikido and as wild as tricking, along with the natural combat forms of animals and "improvisational panic".
Psionic powers of mind and matter: biokinesis, telekinesis, telepathy, and more.
Intensely playtested rules that call back to the games of the 1980s, but with modern refinements. Light tactical combat, investigation, social mechanics, gimmick equipment, montages, and much more!
Human allies, either built from scratch by players or rolled up by random generation. Don't just fight baddies, make friends!
Fully-formed villains ready to menace, from the Proteus Corporation to the otherdimensional Voxnax Velacuss. Will the powerful have their way?
A rough layout inspired by the TRPGs of the early '80s!
SO MANY RANDOM TABLES.
120 pages plus character sheets, mutation worksheets, and combat reference sheets ready to print.


Source: itch.io sales page for Mutants in the Now.

boardgame.name: Bristol 1350: Bonus Character Cards
boardgame.description: Adds 9 bonus character cards to the Bristol 1350 base game. From the back: "Beware of whom you trust, and best of luck!"
