New in shrink (pack)

boardgame.name: 2021 R-A-N-D-O-M Design Challenge Entries
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The 2021 collection of random tables from the wonderful folks on RPG Geek.

boardgame.name: Bounce Bunny Bounce
boardgame.description:
Bounce Bunny Bounce is a two-player, fast-paced strategy game with an element of memory. The object of the game is to collect the most carrots but in order to win, you'll need to avoid some hazards along the way!

Using this unique deck of cards to form the field of play, your Bunny will Bounce across the field in search of carrots while avoiding traps and dead-ends. There is also a chance for mischief as each player is equipped with Shock cards that can be used to Bounce your Bunny into danger.

This easy-to-learn and fun-to-play game is a great choice for folks who are short on time and looking for a game they can Bounce into quickly.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Maquette
boardgame.description:
Maquette

An imaginative love story about fitting things together.

Maquette is a first-person recursive puzzle game that takes you into a world where every building, plant, and object are simultaneously tiny and staggeringly huge. Maquette makes it possible by twisting the world into itself recursively in an MC Escher-esque fashion.

Head to the center of the world and you’ll feel like a giant, towering over buildings and walls. But venture further out, and start to feel small as things get larger and larger - to the point where cracks in the ground become chasms.

In Maquette you will explore the scales of everyday problems in a modern-day love story. Where sometimes the smallest of issues can become insurmountable obstacles.

Starring Bryce Dallas Howard and Seth Gabel.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Spillin' Beans
boardgame.description:
When you think you know your friends, friend's friends or that big mouth that shows up every once in a while, we guarantee you don't...until they spill the beans!

Spillin' Beans is composed of 120 cards that need to be shuffled before starting the game. Players take turns drawing cards: Action, Wild and Big Bean that keep every player on their toes.

If the player fails to complete the action card, they will place 2 beans in the bean pot. The player to stockpile the most beans wins!

With Spillin' Beans you and your friends will spill stories, place bets, reveal the size of your brain through a dynamic, competitive, and hilarious gameplay.

boardgame.name: Empty Rivalry
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the Chinese epic Romance of the Three Kingdoms by Luo Guanzhong, there is a story of the brilliant strategist Zhuge Liang’s “Empty Fort Strategy”. According to the tale, Zhuge Liang knows that he does not have the resources to defend a city held by his Shu army from an impending attack by Sima Yi and his Wei army. Rather than fending off a siege, Liang orders his soldiers to dress up like commoners the soldiers clean the streets and open the gates wide. Zhuge Liang ascends a tower above the gates and plays his guqin , a 7 stringed Chinese instrument, giving every appearance that he is not worried about the army at his gates. When the Wei army arrives, Sima Yi sees the gates wide open and Zhuge Liang unconcerned. The invader concludes that there must be an ambush in the city and orders a retreat. In this game, you will be playing the role of the attacker or defender in an “empty fort” scenario set in the arena of present-day social interactions.

boardgame.name: Sunrise
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A great storm came crashing over us. It shattered the world into fragments. We watched the countless, shimmering shards swirl and dance. Around us, the world has started to take forms again. Soon Sunrise will come, and we will step out into a beautiful new existence in our crafted forms.

Sunrise is a game with three core concepts: giving and accepting compliments, learning from your friends, and creating yourself anew.

boardgame.name: Aether: A Heroic Fantasy RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Aether RPG system is a combination of love, spite and cards in the form of a Fantasy TTRPG designed to give the players as much control over the story of the game as possible.

It's a game with an extreme narrative focus that will see the players making detailed and multifaceted characters whose personal history directly impacts the game being played. It also balances social encounters and tactical combat in order to give players a variety of options when it comes to settling conflict, and it gives the Narrator (game-runner) all the tools they need to plan and run a fun game for their friends.

boardgame.name: Converting to Aether from D&D5e
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents basic processes and advice for playing Aether, aimed specifically at experienced players of D&D.

boardgame.name: Domains and Rulers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Domains and Rulers is an Aether RPG supplement built to incorporate both stronghold/domain management as well as mass warfare tools into the Aether system. It is inherently a collection of subsystems designed to benefit players who care about their characters becoming part of, contributing to and developing their own community in game, with both mechanical and narrative benefits as a result. In the supplement you’ll find rules for creating the key figures in a domain, tracking its size, managing its resources, and certain abilities the players can gain if they manage to make allies or take control of an area. There are also rules for how to defend a domain from attacks, for mass warfare using the existing Aether combat rules as a basis, and more. If you’re looking to give your players a community and a specific area that they care about, interact with and manage as part of your game experience, this may just be what you’re looking for.

boardgame.name: Caustic Jerk
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

about unpleasant dreams // truths // self-preservation

this game is not your friend

boardgame.name: Beecher's Bibles
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Players in Beecher’s Bibles are Jayhakers, Red Legs, Free-Staters; proud abolitionist militant guerilla bands in 1850s Kansas, clashing with the pro-slavery forces of border ruffians and bushwhackers. A "Beecher's Bible" was the name given to the breechloading Sharps rifle that was supplied to and used by anti-slavery forces during the Bleeding Kansas period (1854–1860). The name was inspired by the words and deeds of abolitionist minister Henry Ward Beecher of the New England Emigrant Aid Society.

boardgame.name: Traitor!
Traître!
boardgame.description:
Who? Why? You?

From the introduction:

This tabletop roleplaying game is inspired by the popular friendship wrecking videogame Among Us. Because, you know, if you're willing to sacrifice a friendship to a game, might be better if you make it extra memorable and say goodbye to that friendship with a narrative flair!

boardgame.name: Heroes of Dragon Age
boardgame.description:
The game is light on lore; rather than telling an original story, it is instead based on "what if?" scenarios. Each quest--there are 16 available in the single-player format, exploring extant game lore--is a self-contained map and lets players re-experience key moments from not just the previous Dragon Age games, but also the novels, codex entries and more. For example, quests during the Fifth Blight, and quests telling the story of the fall of Arlathan are available. PvP battles and events are available as well.

The game lets players purchase and collect 3D figures of key characters (called "heroes" in the game) from Dragon Age, form them into a squad, and then battle human and AI-controlled foes. The game functions as a squad-based strategy game with the battles played out automatically and the outcome contingent upon the selection of characters in the five-person party, their abilities and formation on the battlefield, as well as any runes that are buffing the team.

Characters are sorted into different classes (Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, and Mythic) and have rock/paper/scissor-style pros and cons. New characters are obtained in a "lottery" style, with a random chance of obtaining any one character. The likelihood of receiving a Rare or Epic character, for example, is increased by grinding or payment. The Mythic rarity can only be obtained by acquiring a Tome of Ascension, and equipping it onto a Legendary Hero after unlocking its fourth Gear slot. The exception to this is Wisps, which may be naturally acquired as Mythic rarity through Wisp packs, Flash Packs, and in the keyed Giant Wisp quest event.

boardgame.name: Light
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Some few miles off the coast a solitary monolith rises high out of the dark water. This mass of rock, crested with a sheet of green, is the Isle of Scarabeck. Approaching the island from the south you will be confronted with a mass of rocks, caves and low cli?s book ended by two small shingle beaches and each of these beaches has a small jetty to aid in the landing of boats. The west jetty is less commonly used and was originally built during the 18th century for the construction of the small chapel that was built on the island by the Rev' Strathmoor who lived in the chapel until a ?re mostly destroyed it. The eastern jetty is more modern and is preferred for landing on the island now due to the rocks under the waves close to the west. The island rises to the north cling face and looking north from the island there is nothing to see except the open sea stretching to the horizon. It is what lies unseen, beneath the waves, that you should be most aware of though as sitting just below the surface of the waves a reef of hard rocks stretches out from the island for a length of 2 cables. These rocks have been the final resting place of many seafaring adventurers and are the main reason for the existence of the lighthouse that stands on the island.

boardgame.name: Rigged
boardgame.description:
The game is Rigged... but you can't help but play

From the introduction:

You are a hacker who has wracked up way too much debt, and you need a way out. Promises were made and then broken putting you in a tough position. The digital walls are closing in.

boardgame.name: Kleiner Hut, mach's gut!
boardgame.description:
Players each place six cone-shaped playing pieces on the outermost ring and try to reach the center of six concentric circles. Play begins by each player moving a piece to the left or to the right inside the outermost ring, as many spaces as the dice roll. The piece can move over other pieces, but can only cover or stack on another piece that it lands on. When a player covers another player's piece, instead of throwing the next throw, he/she progresses into the second ring.

Another variant exists for 6 players (product code 101/2)

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sanctuary Silo
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Surrounded by over a mile of thick and daunting forest, known by the locals as the Holt of the Coyotes, lies a massive Grain Silo. This silo is home to the bustling metropolitan of Rain Ry. Over 1000 creatures reside herein. Denizens ranging from Mice to Chipmunks, Squirrels to Sparrows and a enormous Irish ElK Hound named Prince Edward; Rain Ry is the only safe haven for miles. Coyotes roam and hunt all the lands and the silo's only protection is the Prince hound himself.

But things are not all fun and games in the Silo. Factions have formed and crime is on the rise. Who holds the power and what troubles seek to stifle the safety of the rodents that reside within?

This Mausritter Adventure Location was created for Rittermarch 2021, a Mausritter Game Jam.

boardgame.name: Devil Grinder
boardgame.description:
From the description:

WAKE UP SUMMONER

You're a Devil Grinder: a rage-propelled inline punk, the dirt in this city and the fertilizer to this madness.

This city is dead, but you're more than alive.

There are 5 other gangs in the 5 other districts.

- The Divine Devourers.
- The Earth's Poison.
- The Arthurian Council.
- The Twisted Beasts.
- The Heretic Horde.

But together they are DEATH.

Broken and scattered, you're a stray dog in a world of wolves.

You must survive.

boardgame.name: 3 x Naturspielspass
boardgame.description:
Three nature-themed games in one :

Which trees can you name?
Where the wild animals live
What lives in the city



Match trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits to collect tree tokens. The player with the most trees wins the game.
The task list determines which African wild animal should be found and photographed. The first to accomplish the task is the safari photo winner and have learnt where his animals live.
A city provides living space for animals. Discovering them and assigning them to the animals is a playful and interesting task.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Halls of the Blood King
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

With the rising of the Blood Moon, the accursed abode of the Blood King returns to this world. The lord of all vampires comes to claim the blood that is owed to him. His halls contain treasures and secrets that would make any ambitious adventurer abandon reason and caution to seek them out. Will you risk your soul for gold and glory in the Halls of the Blood King?

A fantasy horror adventure for characters of 3rd to 5th level.

boardgame.name: TPP Presents Champions Organizations #1
TPP Presents Champions Organizations: SAT SID
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every campaign needs organizations for the players to interact with and in some cases battle. Organizations that can help heroes in the exploits and battles, as well as those that will make a heroes life more complicated. This series will give GMs new organizations to help their campaigns. These won’t be villain groups, instead it will be government agencies, villain support organizations and even new organization creating new villains. Just the thing to relief some of the headaches that GMs have in designing and running campaigns

This 47 page PDF will hold two organizations that GMs can easily slip into their campaigns as is or will little modifications. In this installment SAT and SID will be given.

boardgame.name: Non Magical Special Weapons and Armor In OSR Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In most medieval fantasy settings magic items are not very rare – most adventuring groups hold at least a handful of them, with some of the most common being weapons and armor.

However, in some settings and specific campaigns, magic items are scarce. Without easy access to magic, great craftspeople are encouraged to developed and produce above-average weapons and armor capable of incredible feats, like extremely sharp weapons or very heavy armor designed to not encumber the user. In this title you will find equipment options of the non-magical nature for all characters who want an advantage in battle:

Non-magical modifications to armor
Non-magical modifications to weapons
General modifications to items that can provide a social bonus

boardgame.name: Quiet Revolution Quickstart Bundle
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

This quickstart bundle contains everything you will need to play a 4-hour one-shot game of the Spark RPG in the modern Montréal police drama setting of Quiet Revolution.

Montréal is the second largest city in Canada and its cultural capital. It’s the political heart of the francophone province of Québec. It’s the second largest French-speaking city in the world, just after Paris. It’s an economic powerhouse, with a Gross Domestic Product of over one hundred billion dollars a year and population just under four million.

Its citizens come from every corner of the world, bringing a variety of languages, faiths, and traditions. Ethnic minorities and immigrants bring a cultural richness and diversity to the city. Organized crime preys upon an open-minded, tolerant society. The city has its own share of problems though. That cosmopolitan diversity has led to tension in the streets between different linguistic, religious, and cultural groups. That open-minded and tolerant society gives organized crime the opportunity to thrive.

As members of the Montréal Police force, you’re asked to resolve problems within the community. Your unit is assigned to the most sensitive cases, where tact and discretion can make all the difference. You research, negotiate, arbitrate, and investigate. Protect the innocent citizens of the city from the criminal element. Find a way to keep the city safe. Nothing is simple in this city, and there are no easy answers.

boardgame.name: Elemental Kingdoms Quickstart Bundle
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

This quickstart bundle contains everything you will need to play a 4-hour one-shot game of the Spark RPG in the Fantasy setting of The Elemental Kingdoms.

Once, the kingdom was a place of peace and respect. The capital was a gleaming wonder of white marble and golden statues. The provinces were vibrant cultural centers, with each city specializing in unique arts and sciences. It was the greatest realm the world had ever known, until the invasion.

Now the Kingdom is under siege. Elemental monsters threaten to overwhelm us from every border. Only the four Elemental Orders, wielding their corrupt magics stand between us and total destruction.The monsters destroyed the nations on our borders, through violent invasion and subtle subversion. The desperate refugees rushed into the provinces, who are under attack themselves by the elemental foes.

The monsters wield terrifying elemental sorceries, directly creating or manipulating the essences of the world. The relentless Dwarves commend the mountains themselves and shape ore into supernatural artifacts. The cruel Orks wield blades of flame and hurl bolts of fire. The beguiling Elves whisper great distances and hide themselves in the winds. The corrupting Snatchers can travel the waters and warp their bodies like water.

Only the four Orders, those who have learned the secrets of elemental enchantments, offer any hope to the people of the Kingdom. They invoke the flames’ rage, the deceptive waters, the enduring stone, and the perceptive winds to guard our borders and keep the monsters at bay.

boardgame.name: Crépuscule
Day & Night
boardgame.description:
Day or night? High or low? In each round of the card game Day & Night, players try to decide whether high or low numbers are more valuable based on the cards that everyone plays — and that can change instantly, possibly leaving you in the dark when it comes to scoring.

Each round plays out as follows: First, reveal the top card of the draw pile and place it next to the time card. Next, each player chooses one card from their hand, then reveal them simultaneously; if an odd number of revealed cards have a time symbol, flip over the time card. Then repeat this process, with each player choosing, then revealing another card from their hand, flipping over the time card again if an odd number of revealed cards have the time symbol.

Now determine who won the round: If the time card shows the sun, the color with the highest visible sum among visible cards (which includes the first card revealed) is the winning color; if the time card shows the moon, then the color with the lowest sum wins. All players who have played at least one card in the winning color now collect any visible card and place it in front of them. Remove all the remaining cards from play, deal two cards to each player, then start the next round.

When the deck has no cards in it, the game ends, and players tally their score based on the number of stars on cards in front of them. Whoever has the most stars wins.

boardgame.name: Professor Sielmanns Naturquiz
boardgame.description:
Players answer questions about nature by placing their chips onto a card belonging to one of three categories: air, land, and sea. The questions are about record-breaking and interesting properties of plants and animals.

—user summmary

boardgame.name: The Incandescent Grottoes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bubbling stream cascades into a hole in the earth, leading to a series of underground watercourses and scintillating grottoes. Adventurers who delve within may discover odd mosses and fungi, a ruined temple complex, and the lair of a crystal-eating dream dragon.

A classic expedition into the Mythic Underworld for characters of 1st to 2nd level.

57 keyed areas, rumour table, loot summary, dungeon background info, suggestions for expanding the dungeon.
Keyed in a quick-reference, bullet point format.
Statted for Old-School Essentials (B/X), usable with any vintage adventure game.

boardgame.name: The Isle of the Plangent Mage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An idyllic cove harbours deep secrets. Magic and sound are entwined harmoniously, while dark things lurking in the depths rise to explore new avenues through previously locked portals. Adventurers will be changed as they explore the depths of the Undertower, unlock strange musical puzzles, and reveal the glorious treasures of the Isle of the Plangent Mage.

A fantasy adventure of sonic wonder for characters of 3rd to 5th level.

64 keyed areas, village description and NPCs, rumour table, loot summary, dungeon background info.
Keyed in a quick-reference, bullet point format.
Statted for Old-School Essentials (B/X), usable with any vintage adventure game.

boardgame.name: The Treetop Twits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three archetypes for the monolithic goblin game 'The Saga Of the Goblin Horde'.

Hammy Groingazer, Niklam Hammerface and Jammy Deepthroat are a tribute to Harrison Hunt, Nikk “Lambslice” Lambley and James Clarke, aka “The Three Ts.” The characters are designed for Saga of the Goblin Horde, but their backgrounds contain numerous in-jokes and references to the 3T RPG Podcast.

boardgame.name: 100 Weird Widgets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

100 Weird Widgets is a catalogue of strange and wonderful sci fi gadgets for your OSR games, ranging from semiuseless to extremely powerful.

Many sci-Fi RPGs contain ‘greatest hits of pop culture’ like the ‘Sonic Spanner’ or the ‘Lazer Sword’. But what about all the other inventions that didn’t make it onto the TV shows? Well, they can all be found here.

boardgame.name: Escape From Station 17
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Escape from station 17 is a 0-Level funnel adventure, set in a post-apocalyptic, sci-fi version of our earth. It is for use with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game (or any OSR system) and has been designed as a low prep, quick-to-start adventure.

Included within this pack are 25 premade 0-Level Characters, a one sheet adventure (both sides of an A4 sheet of paper), maps, and statted NPCs/Monsters relevant to the adventure. Additionally; the entire map has been designed to fit onto a single 23x26 vinyl battlemat.


Earth, year 202X. The planet has been taken over by a technologically advanced multidimensional empire known as the ‘Amalgamate’. These fearsome, humanoid creatures conquered the world in only nine hours, and have implemented a violent, unforgiving police-state.

Since the usurpation of earth’s control, our new alien overlords have been slowly draining earth of all of it’s water and sending it back to the Gryx Border-World. And have set about converting humanity into Amalgamate with the use of extremely long, painful and torturous operations (performed with no anasthesia).

Amalgamate conversions are carried out in ‘Alteration Stations’; prison compounds where once-proud humans are fed grey sludge and packed into tiny cells. These poor prisoners are only permitted outdoors once every two months and are not told when their ‘alteration day’ will come.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Houses & Hauntings Revised Edition
boardgame.description:
Houses & Hauntings Revised Edition is a 2-page dungeon crawl TRPG where you play kids exploring a spooky locale, but a mysterious recluse stalks them...

It's time for kids to meddle!
Eighties kid adventure movie shenanigans abound in a light-hearted role-playing game of exploration and frights! Originally created and playtested for "The Shortening" RPG contest, this version has been heavily revised and updated for better play balance, clarity, and even added GM advice. Includes full rules, six character types, villain creation, treasure table, and it all still fits on one double-sided piece of paper!


A tabletop RPG for 3-5 players. Requires some six-sided dice and tokens of your own devising. The Director of the adventure will need to obtain a map and fill it with cool stuff.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Houses & Hauntings Classic Edition
boardgame.description:
Houses & Hauntings Revised Edition is a 2-page dungeon crawl TRPG where you play kids exploring a spooky locale, but a mysterious recluse stalks them...

It's time for kids to meddle!
Eighties kid adventure movie shenanigans abound in a light-hearted role-playing game of exploration and frights! Created and playtested for "The Shortening" RPG contest.


A tabletop RPG for 3-5 players. Requires some six-sided dice and tokens of your own devising. The Director of the adventure will need to obtain a map and fill it with cool stuff.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Forged Keys Cards
boardgame.description:
These cards were given as a prize in Open play events and for participating in Store championships.
They can be used instead of the Tokens provided in the base boxes

boardgame.name: Under Hill, By Water
boardgame.description:
From designer's itch.io page:

Under Hill, By Water is a stand-alone game with parts and procedures familiar to fans of old-school TTRPGs. It's explicitly a game about the quiet pastoral life of halflings so a lot of fat from dragons and/or dungeons has been trimmed off. There are tons of flavorful randomizers to make sure your halfling's life is quiet, but never boring.

boardgame.name: Kingdoms Rise & Fall: Dorian
boardgame.description:
Kingdoms Rise & Fall: Dorian is a strategic deckbuilding game set in a fantasy world (campaign launch on March 22, 2022). Explore Dorian with your unique character that progresses during the game and leads your army into battle. Build your deck of Battle Cards based on your play style with either Stealth, Physical or Magic. Start Siege battles to capture locations or engage in Field battles to defeat your rival armies.

During the game, there will be a lot of player interaction. Players will negotiate, fight tactical Siege and Field battles by using their Battle Cards and they might even betray each other. The player with the most Influencers Points (IP) wins the game. There are alternative victory conditions, like team battles and by capturing the capital.

The duration of the game can be controlled by choosing the number of rounds (Kingdom Event cards) and by setting a goal on the Influence Point Track. Meaning you can play a short 1-hour game or play for six hours or more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jerusalem: '48
boardgame.description:
Jerusalem: '48 is a module for the Arab Israeli War of 1948 focusing on the battle of Jerusalem, from December 1947 to 18 July 1948.

GENESIS II is needed to play this module.
It offers larger hexes, lay-flat, hard boards.
4 scenarios are included.

boardgame.name: Anarchopunk 2020
boardgame.description:
THE ROLEPLAYING GAME OF THE DARK PRESENT

The Corporations control the world from their skyscraper havens, enforcing their rule with offices of drone lobbyists. On the streets, white nationalists roam an infected urban wilderness, bullying and killing those who dare protest. The rest of the world is a perpetual curfew, as exhausted workers remote into work, watching their neighbors get evicted into the meanest streets this side of the apocalypse. The Present never looked so bad. But you can change it. You’ve got friends at your back, instruments packed, pamphlet in hand, and constant political anxiety screaming in your brain. You’re wireless, woke, and wise as you take your philosophy to the Revolution because you have to. Because you’re Anarchopunk.

Anarchopunk: the unoriginal roleplaying game of the dark present; a world of brutal police, state-run bikers, and callous techbros, packed with direct action and the loudest concerts. Within this Portable Document, you’ll find everything you need to take the Revolution to the mean streets of the 2000’s — in a game system that lets you tell your story simply and couldn’t give a single
fuck about realism.

FEATURING:

The Label: Callous shits corrupting your creativity for dollars and change!
Wannabe Warriors: Military fantasists taking the war to the oppressed!
Channers: Abusive political cults formed in the ass-end of the Internet!
Fucks News: State-run media vomiting disinformation to obscure the truth!
Running Dogs: Bikers standing up for oppression and toxicity!
The Fucking Corporation: They’ll burn society down for a dollar!
Techbro.com: Millionaries looking to turn your privacy into profit!
Hard(ass)core: Faux-punks infusing the scene with crime and violence!
Cops: “Maximum lawmen in the big-city jungle!”


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Spheres of Might (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There’s so much more to martial combat than swinging a sword, and so much more to non-magic characters than waiting for the next fight.

Spheres of Might is a new approach to building martial characters in your fantasy games, here updated and adapted for 5th edition fantasy. With 22 Martial spheres at your disposal, Spheres of Might grants incredible new options to your martial characters, whether you are a hulking berzerker, a cunning scoundrel, a charismatic leader of soldiers, and more. These martial spheres can be bought into with subclasses, feats, or 7 new base classes, letting you build virtually any martial combatant you desire, giving them not only new and engaging tactical options, but also letting any character become as useful outside of combat as they are inside.

Within this book, you’ll find:

7 New Classes — including the armiger, the artisan, the alter ego, the commander, the conscript, the scholar, and the striker.

22 Combat Spheres — granting a host of new abilities based on concept, including alchemy, athletics, barrage, barroom, beastmastery, berserker, brute, dual wielding, equipment, fencing, gladiator, guardian, leadership, retribution, scoundrel, scout, shield, sniper, tinker, trap, warleader, and wrestling.

Legendary Talents — for when games deserve to become truly epic, legendary talents allow games to reach beyond the gritty to truly mythical proportions, including leaping mountains, stealing skills, and bending armies of monsters to your will through sheer force of personality.

boardgame.name: Skatepunk
boardgame.description:
The world's first reflex skateboarding tabletop RPG!

Skatepunk is a chill one-page RPG about getting together with your friends and sharing some sick stunts and trying not to get caught by the bastards in blue. If you do, though, it happens, that's the fucking world we life in.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Spheres of Power (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spheres of Power is an alternative magic system with long roots in the D20 fantasy space, here adapted to 5th edition fantasy and presented for your tabletop games. Within these pages you’ll find not only a completely new way to handle magic in your 5e games, but also find the tools you need to rebuild magic from the ground up to suit your needs.

Magic lies at the heart of not only a great many characters, but also a great many worlds, and far too often it is limited by the available rules. What if a player wants to adapt a concept from their favorite video game, anime, tv show, or book that doesn’t rely on traditional fantasy tropes? What if a game designer wants to create a world far outside the assumed setting, where magic comes from communion with moon spirits summoned to fight for the caster, or where magic-users do battle with physically-manifested words of the first language?

Within these pages, you’ll find the tools you need to not only create all-new character concepts, but also to adapt magic to fit the needs of your story and your world. Want to be a martial artist that controls elemental forces through movement? A magical girl fueled by friendship and battling with telekinetically-thrown mountains? A chemist who gains the power of nature through ingesting captured souls? All this and more is possible with Spheres of Power and its unique combination of Magic Spheres and Casting Traditions.

With 5 new base classes and adaptation rules for all core classes, Spheres of Power can easily be used right next to the core magic rules or can completely replace them as you see fit.

Come see for yourself what Spheres of Power can do for you and your games!

boardgame.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union
boardgame.description: The Dominion Faction Pack: The Cardassian Union is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Dominion faction: a Galor class, 2 Keldon class and a Klingon Bird-of-Prey class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. The ships and cards are focused on the Cardassian elements of the Dominion. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

This is the Jerusalem: Siege expansion for owners of Genesis 3, Magach 73 and Ivasion: Palestine!.

This module builds on the Gen/Magach work and includes 6 scenarios, and covers 1948 material from the original Genesis, plus new 1967 actions with an enlarged JERUSALEM Map - in keeping with the MONSTER SERIES, etc. with color rules, and color folio.

Ownership of BOTH Genesis 3 and Magach 73 are a MUST.

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Being a Bad Christian?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What’s So Cool About Being a Bad Christian is a roleplaying game about “bad Christians” with secret sins going through crises of faith as they try to make sense of what they believe in and make a decision as to where they stand; seeking the answer to the question: Will you still choose to believe at the end of the day?
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Cool About Being a Bad Christian?

boardgame.name: nuke
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This game is about the realities of nuclear war. It is grinding and sad and awful. It is not meant to be hopeful, though perhaps it can be a bit noble at times.
...
Players should know that their characters are going to die. This is not a happy game. This is a game about nuclear war.

boardgame.name: So You Want to Take Me to the Fair
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

So some days you’re traveling from town to town, maybe getting some loot, maybe getting saving little bits of the world, and maybe finding some friends. You definitely found this weird crew. At this point, there’s also probably people you’re looking for and other people who are looking for you.
boardgame.rpg: So You Want to Take Me to the Fair
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam

boardgame.name: Blood on Red Soil
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Blood on Red Soil is a solo journaling game about overwhelming odds and acting decisively in the face of near certain death. It is about tapping into a mix of bravery, stubbornness, and a desire to go on set against a backdrop of red landscapes and deadly conditions. It is about feeling anger for being abandoned while also understanding why.

boardgame.name: Boreal Blade
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Boreal Blade is a team-based melee fighting game with a focus on player vs player combat, combining reactionary and tactical gameplay with extraordinary freedom to variate your attacks and develop your unique fighting style.Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ageless
boardgame.description:
Lost, confused and alone. What will Kiara do when she suddenly finds herself with the power to control the age of flora and fauna? An ability that was bestowed onto her by a magical obelisk.

Traverse a puzzle-platforming world unlike any other, full of myths and magic. Embark on an emotional journey where you will be faced with tough choices and must confront your inner demons.

Follow Kiara as she is thrown into a world of wonder and heartache. Manipulate the age of animals and plant-life as you find your way through intricate environmental puzzles and defeat the merciless bosses that stand in your way.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Unlocked Runes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The earth is gone

The gods are real

We must find Valhalla

The runes guide us

Drakar is a sci-fi, indie microRPG inspired by the climate crisis, Norse iconography,
and episodic science fiction television such as Star Trek: The Next Generation and The Expanse.

Unlocked Troubles is the second official expansion to the Drakar core game, featuring 14 new Runes to make your game compatible with long-term campaign play.

boardgame.name: Archduke
boardgame.description:
In Archduke, players have a set of cards (starting with four) placed face-down in front of them: some that they know, and some that they don’t. Each card has a point value, ranging from -3 to 13, shown in the corners of the card. The goal is to have the lowest sum of points at the end of each round, accomplished by swapping, stealing, and getting rid of cards. Points are scored after each round, with the game continuing to an agreed mark when the player with the lowest score wins.

Before the game begins, players have ONE opportunity to look at any TWO of their own cards, returning them to the same face-down position. Players should remember their value and location.

Over a series of rounds, players will draw 1 card and chose to keep the drawn card, exchanging it for one of their own face down cards or immediately discard it, possibly triggering a special ability allowing them to peek at, swap or give additional facedown cards to other players. When any player feels as though they have the lowest hand of cards in front of them, they call Archduke which triggers the final scoring of each round. The lowest score wins.

boardgame.name: Sobek dla 2 graczy
Sobek pro 2 hráče
Sobek: 2 Giocatori
Sobek: 2 Joueurs
Sobek: 2 Players
Sobek: 2 Spelers
Sobek: Das Duell
boardgame.description:
Construction is underway on a temple dedicated to Sobek. A huge market has emerged nearby, supplied by the continuous flow of feluccas and pirogues along the Nile. Your Guild of Merchants is determined to take advantage of this unbelievable opportunity, and ready to use any means to grab sumptuous goods out of the way of your opponent. Beware, though, as it will be crucial not to have accumulated too much corruption when the time of reckonings arrives.

How to play
In Sobek: 2 Players, both opponents collect and sell Goods to earn the most Victory Points. On their turn, the player chooses among 3 options: take a tile on the Market, sell a set of Goods or play a Character. When the player takes a tile, they select one on the Ankh pawn’s line and add it to their hand. They then place the Ankh pawn in the line that is indicated by the tile they just took, which determines the choices available to their opponent.
When they have enough in hand, a player can sell a set of at least 3 tiles of the same type. These tiles will earn them Victory Points at the end of the game, depending on both their quantity and the amount of Scarabs that they feature. A player can also use a Character to benefit from its powerful special ability.
In Sobek: 2 Players, everything is about timing. Planning ahead and analysing which opportunities you offer to you opponent on their next move is key to playing the best moves and winning the game.

—description from the publisher

Title: Sobek: 2 Players Publisher: Catch Up Games Language(s): French Dutch

boardgame.name: Wer würfelt Worte?
boardgame.description:
Players take turns to roll ten letter-dice. The player who can form a word gets a strike on the notepad. If another player can form a word with more letters, he/she gets that strike, and so on and so forth. The player with the most strikes wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Vial of Vanishing Liquid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

This very special vial creates a liquid that can render things invisible when used to paint them.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Philter of Contradictions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Are you feeling lucky?'

This potion of fortune reversal could either help or hinder, but in the right hands it could really turn the fates around for a character.

Rules included for 5E and system agnostic notes.

boardgame.name: Wand of Escape
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

A dream item for a thief or assassin looking to escape capture, with one minor caveat, they must be in real fear for their lives for the wand to work its magic.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Ball of the Silvery Thread
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

This magical ball of thread that has multiple uses in your adventures including tracking the route through mazes, upsetting ghosts and communicating psychically.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Blue Moth Eating Candle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

Bathe in the light from this benevolent candle and soothe away the worries of adventuring.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Quill of Dark Wisdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

A magic quill with knowledge beyond human reckoning that seems to write of it's own accord when used.

What knowledge is going to be scrawled across the parchment?

And will it lead to riches or test the limits of your characters sanity?

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Ring of Chickens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to summon a chicken to your location with only a minor chance of summoning a gargantuan town stomping mega-fowl?

Assuming the answer is "yes, who wouldn't want a chicken!" then, good news, here's the Ring of Chickens.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Enter the Forest
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A setting and encounter generator.
...
The Forest lies at the far western edge of the decadently decaying Empire; a verdant barrier between it and the lush River-lands that lie just beyond. The massive god-trees block out the sun, the ground is swampy and travel by any other method than boat is difficult.

boardgame.name: Ring of Finding
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

Always losing your keys or that artefact you need to defeat the big bad?

Then, fear not, here's the Ring of Finding!

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Ring of Warp Wounding
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

Do you secretly wish that your friend or ally took the damage from that hit and not yourself?

You may be in luck if you can get hold of a Ring of Warp Wounding

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: The Book of Portraits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

A mysterious tome that captures the likeness of any who browse it's pages.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Twinned Chests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system agnostic magic item.

A pair of magically linked chests that can be used to move items through an interdimensional space.

This is a powerful non-combat magic item with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

boardgame.name: Guns, Guns, Guns Issue 1: The HKC Zerstoren Combat Shotgun
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 5 page PDF details a combat shotgun for modern, near future and gritty sci-fi games.

Two variants are detailed, the military and law enforcement models.

Includes ammo tracking worksheet and clear background images to use as tokens etc.

Sample stat blocks are included for:

Stars Without Number
Shadowrun
Prime RPG
D20 Modern

boardgame.name: Make Italy!
boardgame.description:
"Make Italy" is a wargame for 2-6 players that recreates the campaign for the Unification of Italy at the time of the Expedition of the Thousand (1860).
Players control the six Factions involved in the war, each with their own placement and special traits.
By arranging and moving Agents and Troops on the map, players confront each other diplomatically and militarily, forming Alliances and fighting Battles to take control of the future unitary state.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dangerous Items of a Magical Nature
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"A little power is dangerous in the wrong hands... "

A selection a items that players of any level will want, but not all will have the wisdom to use safely.

These are powerful non-combat magic items with many possible uses for inventive players to discover.

A system agnostic collection of 15 magic items in a 19 page fully illustrated pdf.

boardgame.name: Wagon Wheel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Wagon Wheel is a high fantasy game of restoration that follows former adventurers as they find new ways to help. The evil has been defeated, the calamity is over, the tyrant is dead. Now you and your fellow adventurers travel the land repairing what’s been broken and helping folks find their way in a changed world.

Wagon Wheel can be as wild or as grounded as you want! Want your game to be on the moon and populated by bug people? You got it! Want it to take place in a dusty prairie land where magic is all but unheard of? No problem! Want your wagon to be a caravan of, well, covered wagons? That’s great! Want it to be a giant turtle that is chill with you building all over its shell? I like the way you think!

boardgame.name: Two Toned Tussle
boardgame.description:
Two Toned Tussle is a medieval offshoot of Rock, Paper, Scissors. While the main goal of beating your opponent with the better of the three options, (Sword, Staff, or Shield in this case)


The over-arching goal of Two Toned Tussle is to be the player with the highest treasure score at the end of the game. To gain treasure, you must win bouts and earn White cards. While these White cards offer powerful effects to help you retain the upper hand, they can serve you much better by being traded 3 at a time for a Treasure card! Beware though, your opponent isn't exactly defenseless! Each time a player loses a bout, they get to draw a Black card with two of the three weapons on it; allowing even larger weaknesses to be exploited in a comeback maneuver!

A typical game of Two Toned Tussle is about 10-15 minutes long and consists of 3 bouts at a time!

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: From Nightmares
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

RECLAIM WHAT IS OURS!

From Nightmares guides you through the dark and deep to where only monsters roam. This book provides adventurers with exciting new character creation options, such as playing a Nephilim, Woe, Nightmare, or Mimic. Navigate your way through the lost histories of the Neverborn, stumble upon ancient Magia and Immuto, and fight back with wicked blades and blackest tongues.

boardgame.name: Vigil Watch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghelspad Expanded!

Ghelspad is a massive and diverse land. Once a paradise, this continent is now scarred by the ravages of the Titanswar. In the wake of divine bloodshed, and beset on all sides by titanspawn, the people of Ghelspad survive and thrive on this befouled continent. Vigil Watch explores six different locations across Ghelspad.

From the bloody shores of the Toe Islands in the east to the Sweltering Plains of the west, Vigil Watch provides an in-depth look at a variety of locales and cultures.

Vigil Watch contains:

Expanded information on the culture and nomadic home of the ironbred
A detailed view of Leoni, the center of the Manticora Confederacy
The terrifying deadlands of the Festering Fields
An exploration of the Library of Lokil, and much more!

boardgame.name: Dragon Age: The Last Court
boardgame.description:
Dragon Age: The Last Court is a text-based, free-to-play browser game that serves as an interquel between Dragon Age II and Dragon Age: Inquisition.

The player takes on the role of the Marquis of Serault, a marquisate located on the western edge of Orlais. The Marquise (played as either The Huntress or The Scholar) guides Serault through a tumultuous part of its history, making decisions that affect not only the player but the region and its relation to the wider world. Affairs of court will be managed, and positions of counsellor, lover, bodyguard, and other roles will be chosen.

The Last Court was deactivated on November 17, 2020.

boardgame.name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons: Slayer
boardgame.description:
Advanced Dungeons & Dragons: Slayer is a fantasy first-person, dungeon crawl action role-playing game based on the second edition of Advanced Dungeons and Dragons.

Slayer features a customizable dungeon generator so each time the player starts the game, they are faced with a new dungeon. The dungeon always ends with a boss floor, randomly selected from several possible bosses. When starting a new game, the player may either create a custom character with randomly generated stats, pick from a selection of preset characters, or reuse a previously created character. The game may be saved at any time, but is limited to a single save slot.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Dungeons_%26_Dragons%3A_Slayer Advanced Dungeons & Dragons: Slayer]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Rally Point Volume 14: The 1940 Campaign in the West
boardgame.description:
Includes ASL Scenarios from The Tampa ASL Group (2017). Action in Belgium, France & The Netherlands.

RP 131: Boot's Scoot and Boogie
RP 132: Probe Toward The Hague
RP 133: The Recapture of Ockenburg
RP 134: Von Sponeck's Woods
RP 135: The Outpost Line
RP 136: La Riposte Vaine
RP 137: Chateau Gandelu
RP 138: The Chivres Shivaree
RP 139: Mauled at Merdorp
RP 140: Warwickshire at Wormhouldt

boardgame.name: Heart Full of Trash
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Even Raccoons need love!

And what better way to celebrate that love than to go on a date to the fanciest garbage can in town (it has 2 stars on GarbageReviews)!

boardgame.name: Dragonmaw Cave
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Olkana, a kindly, young brass dragon, has lived for several decades in Dragonmaw Cave to the north of town. Though no one has seen any sign of her in months, the elders suspected she was hibernating or nesting a clutch of eggs. Recently, some claimed to see at least one hatchling dragon awkwardly flying across the sky at night. This doesn't seem like kindly Olkana's newborn, though. Livestock and pets have been stolen, travelers have gone missing, homes and shrines have been desecrated, and even some wells have gone foul. Unsure of what to do, you've traveled three days to Dragonmaw Cave to see if the elusive Olkana can help.

boardgame.name: Celestial Bodies, Orbital Mechanics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Celestial Bodies, Orbital Mechanics is a game about diaspora and returning home; about receiving and committing violence; and a game about struggling to shape events far larger than the individual. It poses questions about colonialism, culture, and bodies.

boardgame.name: Playing Kindly
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Thoughts on safety, securely, and integrity in analog games.

boardgame.name: Spy School
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Congratulations! You made it. Not many people your age get chosen for Spy School. You truly are amazing. But will you be the best? Can you become the greatest spy in the world? Lets find out shall we? Are you ready?

User summary:

Spy School is a solitaire roleplaying game intended for play by children. The game is presented as a series of activities intended to "train" the player how to be a spy.

boardgame.name: MELWAFF - My Exciting Life With a Fantasy Foreigner!
boardgame.description:
They came from another world, but it's not an invasion, it's an immigration.

Dragons, devils, and druids live among us, just trying to get by. Holy swords are put to use chopping carrots instead of slicing skeletons. The Mystery Integration Bureau oversees the the newcomers' introduction to modern Earth society, while ordinary people acclimate to the strangers. And not everything is going to go smoothly... where does a witch park her walking hut? What's it like having an unicorn for a roommate?

Can a stone golem keep up in the fast-paced world of advertising?

Winner of the Okashicon x NinjaHELL! Productions Anime RPG Design Contest,MELWAFF: My Exciting Life With a Fantasy Foreigner is a tabletop storytelling RPG dramedy where everyday people meet fantasy folk and anime-styled hijinks result. Play an Earth native, a fantasy "newcomer", or a M.I.B. agent and tell a story of what happens when the magical and bombastic meets the modern world. Seek your dreams either mystical or mundane, as your friends join in with shenanigans. Enjoy legitimate surprise mechanics as the "Fate Deck" introduces new twists and hopes throughout every episode of play!

A tabletop RPG for 4-8 players. Includes a 22 page rulebook, a print-and-play tarot deck designed by Christopher Reynolds for use with the game, or it can be played with an existing tarot deck.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: MELWAFF - My Exciting Life With a Fantasy Foreigner!

boardgame.name: Drive-in Double Feature
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a lighthearted slice of life story game about young adults trying to escape reality and being forced to confront it simultaneously. Our game tells two stories: one projected on the screen and another told in our car. The events of the movie reflect our personal goings on and our relationships and interactions add to the action on screen for all to see. We will switch back and forth through play and explore both simultaneously. We all play as 20-somethings in a friend group packed into a car at the drive-in movie theater on the last night before we part ways for an unknown amount of time. This game has no gamemaster, every player has an equal authorial voice and works together to explore the characters and the film in the background.

boardgame.name: Space Adventure Hero (^^)b Edition
boardgame.description:
Earth needs a hero, but space... needs a SPACE HERO!
The stars are wilder and more dangerous than anybody could have imagined, but that's why we have a SPACE HERO, strong enough to save the entire galaxy! Collaboratively create a SPACE HERO you take turns playing, along with their rotating cast of followers, acquaintances, and villains!

A space story of SIDEBANGS, SIDEBURNS, and SPEED LINES!
This game features:

CONVICTION! A hero's beliefs and code will be tested, and change over time!

DANGER! A villain actively works to towards an evil scheme only the hero can stop!

RATINGS! The new popularity system lets players choose what cast members return more often, while still providing room for surprises!

SEQUELS! Just because the hero's adventures are over doesn't mean it's time for an ending! The new play options, exclusive to the (^^)b Edition, lets you take a member of the supporting cast and make a whole new adventure.

A tabletop storytelling game for 4-6 players. Requires some regular six-sided dice, index cards or similar, some tokens of your choice, and writing tools. Revised for 2020!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Logomancy
boardgame.description:
Look around you. We live in a sea of symbiology, and the wealthy and powerful jam their symbols and brands right into our eyeballs in every waking moment we have. It's time to pick up your cans, markers, and rollers, and make a mark of your own.

Paint the change you want to see in the world.

Logomancy is a new adept school powered by graffiti and semiotics,

Discover secret messages hidden in the text all around you.
Change the meanings of symbols and the reality they create.
Influence your neighborhood with the power of art.
Coopt corporate symbolism and steal its power.
Vomit up a load of vibrant paint, if that's your thing.
Designed for use with Unknown Armies 3rd Edition. Also features a new identity, the street artist, and pretty pictures of possible vandalism.

boardgame.name: Royal Wedding XXL (fan expansion for Kingdomino)
boardgame.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion. Produced with permission of Blue Orange, for non-commercial use only.
Play a (really long) game by using Kingdomino, Queendomino, Age of Giants, Fantastic Era and up to two times The Court.

You'll play with three to five players (or up to 10 as teams), build 7x7 to 9x9 grid kingdoms, with resources, giants, construct a lot of buildings, recruit characters, go through confusing events, etc.
Play long games full of pitfalls!

Do you dare to take up the ultimate challenge of the Kingdomino universe ?

—description from the designer

---------- French below ----------

Il s'agit d'une extension non officielle réalisée par un fan. Produite avec la permission de Blue Orange, pour un usage non commercial uniquement.
Jouez une (très longue) partie en utilisant Kingdomino, Queendomino, Age of Giants, Fantastic Era et jusqu'à 2 fois La Cour.

Vous jouerez de 3 à 5 joueurs (ou jusqu'à 10 en équipes), construirez des royaumes en 7x7 ou jusqu'en 9x9 (voire même plus), avec des ressources, des géants, vous construirez des bâtiments, recruterez des personnages, traverserez des événements déroutants, etc.
Préparez-vous pour une partie longue... et semées d’embûches !

Oserez-vous relever ce défi ultime de l’univers Kingdomino ?

—description du concepteur

boardgame.name: The Shrine of Tristan the Trickster
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Shrine of Tristan the Trickster is an ancient and enigmatic location in the forests of the Mouse kingdoms. One that bestows mice with blessings and curses according to the whims of its magical dice. Some mice are brave enough to seek it and test their fortune at it, despite the risk of dangerous (and maybe even lethal) outcomes.

boardgame.name: Emeric's Pilgrimage
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Emeric was a symbol of valour and knightly virtues in the bygone times. Many bards sang of his heroic deeds. After his greatest Crusade, he decided to take a pilgrimage to the monastery in Graven-Tosk. The monastery is famous for being the final resting place of Prince Jarema – a bloodthirsty, gold hoarding noble.

When he reached the foot of Mount Golgotha the Basilisks revealed themselves and turned Emeric into a crude stone statue.

Now cursed for all eternity, he moves a finger-length a year towards the Monastery of the Profane Cross. When he finishes his pilgrimage, the world will end.

boardgame.name: The Pit
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Pit is a one page dungeon about adventurers who explore a strange chasm in the far frozen north. Going too deep might disturb some of The Pit's alien residents.

boardgame.name: No Place Like Home
boardgame.description: Humanity Trashed the Earth and left for Mars. Only a few people remained. Clean the Environment and gather resources. Find new fluffy friends and robot allies. Rebuild your village and environment and run your own post apo farm as there is No Place Like Home!

boardgame.name: Astingrad 24XX
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There is a saying, “All knowledge returns to Astingrad”. A library older and larger than most cities, Astingrad owes its endurance and reputation to its impressive retrieval teams. Strange groups that recover overdue or stolen books, protect its knowledge, and procure new objects of interest to help grow its massive and mysterious collection.

boardgame.name: Wallet Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Have a pocket full of business card RPGs?

Here's a business card full of dungeons to use them with!

boardgame.name: Monkey Spank!
boardgame.description:
Monkey Spank! is a simple adult themed pattern recognition game in which players try to find an image shown on two cards.

Each card in Monkey Spank! features eight different symbols, with the symbols varying in size from one card to the next. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. For the basic Monkey Spank! game, one card is placed face up in the center of the table and players are dealt the remaining cards face down. Players simultaneously reveal the top card from their decks and try to find the symbol in common with their card and the center card. Which ever player is first to yell out their matching symbol (for example, "ball gag!") places their card as the new center card. That player then reveals the next card in their deck and all players repeat the process. The first player that runs out of cards in their deck is the winner.

boardgame.name: Far From Home
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You were cast adrift among the stars, a shining beacon of humanity far f rom home and its comforts. You are a pioneer, you are a dream, a civilization’s crowning achievement. You have been sent out to learn, and discover, to take in the wild beauty of the universe, to see sights that have never been seen by any living creature, to bring all of wild creation into focus, to be the observer of the glory of existence.

You are lonely.

boardgame.name: Spin the Bottle to the Death
boardgame.description:
A kissing party game about killing your clones

From the introduction:

What happened?

Don't you remember? You cloned yourself. You stepped into that room, pressed the button, and out stepped you and all these copies of you.
boardgame.rpg: Spin the Bottle to the Death

boardgame.name: Pilot's Light
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

> In the outer limits of the system you are the first to encounter the Vespidae. They make planet fall and burrow into the planet digging out their hive, infecting the planet, and the populous. Get down there and kill some bugs, pilot.
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam

boardgame.name: The World After
boardgame.description:
Roleplaying post-humanity as they forge a new world after the climate cataclysm

From the back of the book:

You hold in your hands everything you need to enter the unique universe of The World After. This is a world that feels familiar, but gives a new perspective on current global turmoil, imagining the Earth after humanity, 8,000 years after the Climate Cataclysm and a 20 meter sea-rise, where the emerging societies must cooperate to face new threats from old foes.

boardgame.name: Hungry Bunnies on Parade
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Carrot Meadows - a town where the bunnies love to put on costumes and parade about. As a good bunny owner, you will help them to do both. Oh, and they also love to eat. So don't forget to feed them some tasty treats along the way!

In this fast-paced game, players compete to have the most victory points at the end of the game by collecting the best combination of cute costumes, tasty treats, and long bunny parades.

Hungry Bunnies on Parade is an adorable and competitive card-and-dice game for the whole family. Push your luck to reward bunnies with food, strategically collect bunnies, costumes, and treats, and then compete for the most points and best parades!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: My Brain is a Stick of Butter
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game that you play with yourself about what it’s like living with a brain like mine in a world like ours. I’m not a psychiatrist, but one did diagnose me with ADHD-PI about 7 years ago. I was a college student struggling to get through my classes in pursuit of a degree I had totally lost interest in. With the amount of student debt I was accruing, I didn’t want to switch my major to something more enjoyable at that point. With the help of many patient friends (thank you Zack, thank you Rhi), I ended up graduating with a B.S. in physics. I don’t remember most of the details of the higher level courses, but I’m glad I finished.
boardgame.rpg: My Brain is a Stick of Butter

boardgame.name: Uneasy Lies the Head
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A cracked throne, an imploded sun, revolution at the gates: disaster looms over the realm as self-serving nobles plot and scheme to shape the world to their liking. When those visions clash, turmoil erupts and the court is thrown into chaos.

User summary:

The 36-page PDF game document is distributed with a ZIP archive of playbooks (7 PNG files).
boardgame.rpgartist: Les Musées de la Ville de Paris

boardgame.name: Dubious Pursuits
boardgame.description:
A Game of Bounty Hunters and Loaded Questions

From the introduction:

Welcome Bounty Hunters! Your crew has come to the Spaceport of Deserin in search of Bounty that will pay this months bills. All you’ve been given is a picture and a crime. Your aim is to learn enough about this person to be able to track them down. But in the end, will you want to turn them in?

boardgame.name: Hunt for the Lonely Queen: Operations with the Tirpitz in the North Atlantic, November 1941
boardgame.description:
Hunt for the Lonely Queen is the second on Long Face Games's series of operational campaign and scenario packs for Find, Fix and Strike.

This pack covers the planned raid by the Tirpitz and Admiral Scheer into the North Atlantic, pursued by the Royal Navy and with the USN playing an uncertain role.....

boardgame.name: Mystery Mutts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You've been hired to investigate a spooky mystery.

Also, you are a dog.

boardgame.name: Fur One Night Only!
boardgame.description:
A Party Roleplaying Game for Musical Theater Fans

From the introduction:

Fur One Night Only is a roleplaying game inspired by a popular musical about cats who sing and dance. It’s a one-shot game, which means you can play it in a single session of 2-4 hours. It’s also a party RPG, which means you can play it right after reading the rules, with no experience in RPGs (or musical theater).

boardgame.name: Ranch Simulator
boardgame.description: The Realistic Multiplayer Agriculture Management Sandbox; Farm, Harvest, Hunt & Build.

boardgame.name: Arid
boardgame.description: Welcome to Arid, a small and contained open world survival experience set during the 1930s in one of the driest places in the world
